Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky, toasty black-fruit aromas are lightly charred but calm and stately. This has bounce to its step, but mostly the palate is dry, tannic and aggressive: an indication that this needs more time in bottle. Toasty blackberry flavors are backed by savory meatiness, while this shows chewy tannins on a warm finish with lots of depth. Best from 2023–2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Astrales 2017 Christina Colección Familiar  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are accompanied by savory notes and leathery warmth. Going in a different direction, the palate is crisp, tight and dry, with strapping muscularity. Black plum, wild berry, earthy spice, lemony oak and chocolaty support combine to create a superb flavor profile, while this is focused and firm on the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Garmón 2017  Ribera del Duero

Description: This offers a heady bouquet of scrubby herbs and flowers with red currants, cassis, black olives and something mineral and slightly charred. It's full bodied with tangy, brambly fruit tempered by sappy, savory tannins. There's poise amidst power and a lengthy finish. A European vibe with the fruitiness of the New World. Drink with a wide range of Mediterranean cuisine until 2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hans Family Estate 2016 Tempranillo (Marlborough)

Description: From the cool climes and interesting soils of Beechworth in Victoria, this is a high-toned, lucid Tempranillo with a hearty dose of varietal charm. It weaves strawberry and cherry fruit with cedar, cigar box, baking spice and a meaty undertone. It's medium weight, with a supple, well-placed tannins and sappy, savory nuances which add complexity to the bouncy berry fruit. It's a fresh, versatile food wine that scribbles outside Aussie red-wine lines.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Fighting Gully Road 2016 Tempranillo (Beechworth)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, earthy black-plum and blackberry aromas are backed by hints of prune and chocolate. Gravelly tannins and choppy acidity combine to create roughness on the palate, while this tastes of baked black fruits backed by savory depth and toasted richness that rises up the longer this sits. Chewy tannins make for a dense finish; drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Astrales 2017  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Gorgeous blueberry and black-cherry flavors light up this rich, velvet-textured wine, giving it a wonderful, saturated fruit core blanketed by fine-grained tannins that promise a long period of flavor evolution in the cellar. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2017 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Thick and deep aromas of black currant and blueberry meet with minty cocoa and wood spice on the nose of this bottling, which includes 12% Grenache. Fine-grained tannins frame the unctuous cassis flavors, whose ripe and viscous core is further balanced by a blast of acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Caliza 2018 Sympatico Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Alluring black-cherry and blackberry aromas are accented by orange-peel and baking-spice notes, forming a complex nose. A tight, drawing palate with raw tannins is clampy, while this crianza tastes of blackberry, black plum and prune prior to a dry, drawing finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2017 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Floral plum and berry flavors are unusually candied and less rich than what most Moro wines have delivered in the past. A grabby, pinching palate is clamping, while this offers oaky plum and raspberry flavors accented by minty green and herbal notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Emilio Moro 2017 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Fully ripe aromas of plum and berry fruits are earthy and suggest prune, lactic oak and a hint of paint. This reserva from a marginal vintage is full and round, with honest acidity. Dried flavors of blackberry and raisin are leathery and salty, while spice-cake notes and a hint of oxidation appear on the finish; drink sooner rather than later.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2017 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated and firmly tannic, this bold and focused wine offers brilliant black- and red-fruit flavors that are generously accented by black pepper, wood char and anise. Nicely layered and complex, it is also built for aging. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2018 Estate Grown Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This massive wine offers deep, dark-fruit flavors and hauntingly floral and spicy accents on a full body buoyed by moderate tannins and a velvety, gripping texture. There's no hurry to drink this concentrated and well-structured wine: best after 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Miraflores 2017 Estate Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart black plum, cola, dried herbs and a rocky minerality greet the nose in this bottling. There is a firm and rocky grip to the palate, which contrasts the fresh blueberry flavor. It needs a tad more time, but will drink well for at least a decade. Drink 2022–2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Lanterns 2018 Tempranillo (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This powerful yet balanced wine begins with black cherry, caramel and vanilla aromas while the palate's jammy fruits are lifted by star anise and red licorice. It's all bound together by the grape's stereotypically tight tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rabble 2018 Mossfire Ranch Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in a mixture of 50% new American and Slovakian oak for 18 months, this wine offers pleasing aromas of sweet baking spice, vanilla and cherry, followed by full-bodied, creamy feeling plum and vanilla flavors. The oak plays a large part in the show but plays it well.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2018 Red Heaven Vineyard Tempranillo (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich black-cherry aromas meet with vanilla and even fudge on the thick nose of this bottling, which includes 15% Sangiovese. The tannins are well polished on the lavish sip, which is viscous with smoked berry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2018 Life Saver Tempranillo (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Layers of velvety tannin give this full-bodied wine a robust, mouthfilling character while its fully ripe plum and blueberry flavors are tasty and deep enough to match the big structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Winery SF 2017 Tempranillo (North Coast)

Appellation: San Antonio Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is a bit shy at first, before allowing aromas of strawberry, red plum and crunchy cranberry to emerge. It's quite subtle for the usually bold grape, with rustic tannins framing flavors of crushed stone and dried red fruits.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Absolution 2018 Pierce Ranch Tempranillo (San Antonio Valley)

Description: Blackberry, prune, cinnamon and chocolate aromas lead to a lush, wide-bodied palate that spreads out with comfort and class. Blackberry, chocolate and coffee are the key flavors on this warm-year single-vineyard reserva. Richness and chocolaty depth carry over to the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Gómez de Segura 2015 Finca Ratón Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Lightly baked black fruit aromas are oaky and powerful, while this feels dry, firm, tannic and well structured for a warm-year Rioja. Lush berry, black currant and dried beef flavors come with plenty of oak, while tannic pinch and dryness anchor a full-sized finish with oaky spice. Drink through 2034.                      Michael Schachner
Name: San Vicente 2015  Rioja

Description: Nicely perfumed aromas of purple flowers, dark berry fruits, tobacco and mountain brush are highly appealing and set the stage for a full and lively palate that's slightly choppy and prodding. Woody barrel spice and vanilla notes accompany plum, cassis and cinnamon flavors, while this warm-vintage reserva that spent two years in French oak feels strapping and shows nice length on the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Señorío de Villarrica 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Foresty berry and spiced black cherry aromas blend with notes of dried fruits and pipe tobacco. A supple palate is full and resolute but charming, with smooth tannins and a welcome pop of lively acidity. Integrated flavors of plum, currant and peppery spice are supported by creamy vanilla oak through the finish. Drink through 2031.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2014 Óscar Tobía Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Befitting a warm vintage like 2015, this reserva smells of ripe blackberry, prune, spice cake and cedary oak. The palate is stout and balanced, with pulpy weight offset by healthy acidity. Blackberry, cassis, cola and oaky flavors finish long and smooth. Enjoy through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Gómez de Segura 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A dark color and ripe aromas of blackberry, prune, lemony oak and graphite get this crianza off to a serious start. A concentrated palate feel is juiced up by bright acidity, while this tastes of wild berry fruits topped with chocolaty oak. Drink this smooth operator through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas LAN 2017 Crianza D-12  (Rioja)

Appellation: Pago de Arínzano, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blackberry and prune aromas are backed by cheesy oak and vanilla notes as well as hints of tobacco and cedar. A deep palate is concentrated and showing proper balance, while this Pago-specific Navarran Tempranillo tastes of blackberry, wood spice and bacon. A jammy finish is thick and somewhat creamy in texture. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Arínzano 2014 Gran Vino Tempranillo (Pago de Arínzano)

Description: Cool herbal notes atop berry fruit aromas lend a spicy, mildly green essence to the nose. The palate on this single-vineyard Rioja is a bit wiry and acidic, but that also means that this feels fresh and juicy. Tangy plum, currant, tomato and berry flavors are backed by spicy oak and licorice notes, while this stays fresh on an acidity-driven finish that guarantees a long life. Drink through 2034.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Contino 2017 Viña del Olivo  (Rioja)

Description: Rooty, reedy aromas of licorice and fennel blend with oak grain and spiced berry and cherry scents to form a welcoming nose. The palate on this gran reserva from a difficult year feels lean and linear, with raw acidity. Plum, currant and vanilla oak flavors turn dry, tight, snappy and a touch tart on the finish. Drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2014 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Smoky, tarry aromas blend with wild berry and cured beef scents, while this crianza is medium in body with zesty acidity that creates a racy palate feel. Flavors of plum and tomato sauce dwell on the savory side, while this is composed and fresh on the finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2017 Reciente Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Prickly aromas of pine needle and summer herbs provide sharp accents to an otherwise earthy nose with tobacco and spicy berry fruit scents. While this feels plump and full, the tannins are edgy and rubbing. Blackberry, chocolate, coffee and oaky flavors of vanilla and spice finish with tobacco notes and a touch of heat. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2017 Viñedos de Altura  (Rioja)

Description: Woodsy raspberry and currant aromas are dry and distant, while this gran reserva from a difficult vintage feels solid and gets the job done. Toast, coffee and wood spice notes accent raspberry and plum flavors, while a steady finish is dry feeling and tastes lightly spiced. The future is now for this. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2014 Cune Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cherry, cassis and blackberry aromas are standard for Ribera del Duero but score points for being undemanding and clean. A tightly wound palate is full but not heavy, and blackberry and earthy black plum flavors finish warm, round and pleasant. For a large-production wine from a marginal year, this is impressive.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2018 Damana 5  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Blackberry, cassis and jammy blueberry aromas include hints of vanilla and nutmeg. On the palate, this feels fleshy and grabby. Wild berry, herbal plum and dry brush flavors lead to a finish with clinging tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Gómez de Segura 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from Funk, Dugger Creek and Watermill Estate vineyards. The aromas bring notes of funk, roasted coffee bean, fresh and dried tobacco and ember. A savory, graceful, dried tobacco-filled palate follows. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2017 Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of plum and berry blend with a hint of leather in this red. Harmonious flavors of raspberry, currant and plum are aided by barrel-driven hints of vanilla and brown sugar, while a hearty finish offers good drive.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ramón Bilbao 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Plum, prune and leather aromas set up a lively palate with vibrant acidity. Plum, currant, vanilla and tobacco flavors form a classic Rioja mix, while vanilla, brown sugar and chocolate hints soften the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Raisin and cassis aromas range from fully ripe to overripe, while this is baked and a touch flabby in feel, with moderate to low acidity. Dried berry, plum and cassis flavors land on raisin and prune, indicating that finding balance was a challenge in 2014. Desiccation on the finish brings this gran reserva back to raisiny. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Contino 2014 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Reedy currant and raspberry aromas are a bit sharp and hint at green, while the palate is fuller almost to the point of creamy. Herbal notes of mint and thyme accompany red plum and cherry flavors. On the finish, punchy acidity, lingering green hints and mild oaky vanilla combine forces.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Reserva Tempranillo (Navarra)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are a touch jammy and include hints of vanilla and spiced beef. The palate on this barrel-select Rioja is compact in feel, while plum and currant flavors are aided by conventional oak spice. Light oak and related cinnamon and spice notes hang around on a mild finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ramón Bilbao 2016 Limited Edition  (Rioja)

Description: A ripe and forward nose leans heavily on balsamic plum and berry aromas with oaky support. A wide and full palate is a touch flat and heavy, while this tastes of fully toasted oak, black cherry, dark plum and raisin. Dry tannins and oak rule the back end of this rich and figgy crianza.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Xtrème Crianza Made With Organic Grapes
Name: Bodegas LAN 2017 Xtrème Crianza Made With Organic Grapes  (Rioja)

Description: This value-priced winner is about as good and honest as everyday Rioja gets. Earthy cherry and plum aromas are inviting, while this earns points for fullness, balance and appealing flavors of spiced cherry and plum. Drink up.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kirkland Signature 2016 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Scratchy red plum and currant aromas set up a palate with gravelly tannins that cause moderate roughness. Plum, cherry and tomato sauce flavors come with a touch of wood spice, while this is fresh and lively on a racy finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vivanco 2017 Crianza Selección de Familia  (Rioja)

Description: Plum and raspberry aromas show a spot of lemony oak in front of a lively palate bolstered by juicy acidity. Cherry, raspberry and currant flavors come with hints of green peppercorn and green herbs, while light spice notes are spread across the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Ugalde 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A compact nose smells of bacon and rubbery black fruits, while this feels gravelly and sticky due to pronounced tannins. Roasted berry and barbecued flavors of pork ribs, baked beans and oak spice finish dry and clamping.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alonso López 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: From a vineyard located 3,000 feet above the Temecula Valley, this bottling is very extracted and rich. It offers aromas of black plum, raisin and gingerbread. The palate shows espresso and gingersnap flavors atop a rich fig marmalade core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Temecula Hills 2016 Estate Tempranillo (California)

Description: Ripe berry and raisin aromas lead to a slightly syrupy palate. Flavors of prune and raisin are supported by chocolaty oak on the palate. This is a straightforward and ripe but enjoyable Rioja.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Eguía 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Initial aromas of raisin and spice cake match a dark color and suggest full ripeness. Following that lead, this is plump in feel, with mild tannic rub. Slightly baked berry flavors ease into a finish with mild heat and a raisiny aftertaste.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2016 Finca Torrea  (Rioja)

Description: Saucy barbecued aromas lead a nose with reedy green hints, earthy plum scents and raisiny overtones. A flush palate is rough and edgy, while this crianza tastes of baked plum and raisin prior to a finish with marinated beefy notes and residual oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luxus One 2017 Crianza Singular Wine  (Rioja)

Description: Cherry, plum, leather and tobacco aromas are fairly deep and concentrated on the nose. A hefty palate brings flavors of prune, black plum and green herbs. A chocolate note arises on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2017 Arienzo Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Cherry, plum, leather and tobacco aromas are fairly deep and concentrated on the nose. A hefty palate brings flavors of prune, black plum and green herbs. A chocolate note arises on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2017 Arienzo Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of warm tar and earthy black plum set up a full palate that's wide in scope. Oaky flavors of clove and mint accent herbal plum and berry fruit notes, while this doesn't change much on a finish with tannic rawness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Proelio 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Friendly berry and cassis aromas are balsamic and baked, with a note of molasses. This ripe and beefy Toro is creamy in feel, with sticky tannins. Roasted berry, cassis and chocolaty oak flavors finish short and woody.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2018 Triton Old Vines  (Toro)

Description: Lemony oak and wood grain aromas are upfront on this barrel-driven Rioja reserva. A tight palate is drawing and tannic, while this emphasizes woody flavors and related spice more than fruit character. Fittingly, this tastes lightly woody on a lighter-weight finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Señorio de Ondarre Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Candied cherry and raspberry aromas are backed by a palate that's fresh on first impression then more jammy and simple as this airs out. Cherry, plum and berry flavors are friendly but generic, while this feels jammy on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Gormaz 2018 12 Linajes  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy red berry aromas show a touch of spice while leading to a hard-hitting palate that's narrow and aggressive. Plum, currant and vanilla flavors are common for Rioja, while this is dry and kicking on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Primeur  (Rioja)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice, wood and cherry lead to vanilla-laden, creamy-feeling flavors backed by astringent tannins. The oak gets far out in front of the fruit.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Elevation Cellars 2016 Black Peak StoneTree Vineyard Tempranillo (Wahluke Slope)

Description: A rustic nose includes dark berry notes as well as rubbery harshness. A raw and grabby palate is tannic but doesn't show much structure or depth. Lightly green berry flavors are dunked in oak, while this tastes of clove and wood grain on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Anzil 2018 La Poda  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rubbery aromas suggest new tires. A sticky, resiny palate tastes heavily worked, with vanilla oak flavors running wild. A woody, grainy finish includes a can't-miss green note.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Portia 2018 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: An oak-dominated nose features aromas of wood grain and vanilla, with a deep well of black plum and blackberry. Concentration and structure are hallmarks of the palate, while this warm-year Rioja tastes of black cherry, spiced black plum, blackberry and chocolate. Baking spice flavors take over on the finish. Best from 2024–2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2015 Aro  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe aromas of baked berry fruits and raisin are accompanied by notes of tobacco and spice. On the palate, this leans heavy and shows some heat. Ripe blackberry, vanilla, mocha and chocolate flavors finish lush. Dig deep and this Tempranillo shows complexity and style, but on the surface it's simply ripe and delicious. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega 202 2015 Ansa  (Rioja)

Description: Fully ripe blackberry, cassis and prune aromas are a touch brandied and heady, indicating that this reserva from a high-quality year needs a bit more time. A plump palate is both fleshy and flashy, with good depth. Plum, raspberry, currant and chocolaty oak flavors finish full and a touch creamy. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Contino 2016 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An impressive, tannic texture dominates the taste of this full-bodied, gorgeously ripe and mouthfilling wine. It holds dark-berry and cherry flavors in masses of fine-grained tannins and peppers them with baking spices, cedar and vanilla for added complexity. Enjoyable now with rich foods, but best after 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap NV Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Description: Meaty berry aromas come with notes of herbs, wild flower and oaky wood spice. This reserva from a warm year is solid as a rock and medium-plus in mouthfeel and structure. Ripe black-fruit flavors are backed by peppery notes of well-toasted oak, while this remains steady on a long finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Única Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strongly mineral aromas of wet rocks, lanolin and bloody meats converge with crumple herbes de Province on the earthy nose of this intriguing bottling. The palate combines dark-cherry and berry flavors with cracked pepper, sprinkled herbs and wood spice, with that rocky element lingering in the background.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Gali 2016 Tempranillo (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Smoky and subtle up front and then finely built throughout, that's how this excellent gran reserva unfolds. Crisp, almost minerally aromas of red plum, currant and dry spices lead to a palate with depth and bright acidity. Snappy red-fruit flavors remain juicy across a finish that's level and doesn't waver. This contains 20% Graciano in addition to Tempranillo, and the zest from the former shows. Drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2011 Royal Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe blackberry aromas are lightly charred and lemony. On the palate, this warm-year reserva is full and saturated, with more than ample depth and weight. Blackberry and cassis flavors are backed by chocolaty oak and a dried note of prune, while this is flush and meaty on a full finish. Best for fans of full-bodied reds with notable oak. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2015 Martin Cendoya Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Gritty olive and rubbery black-fruit aromas give this gran reserva an earthy, reduced opening. That's contrasted by sharp acidity, which brightens plum and savory berry flavors. Plum and chocolate notes come with coffee-like blackness on a finish where lively acidity reappears. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Heavy oak gives this warm-year Tempranillo a nose defined by baked black fruits, vanilla, cinnamon and wood grain. The palate is sappy and huge, a heavyweight with modest finesse. Roasted blackberry and cassis flavors sit atop oaky bedding, while this feels jammy and tannic on a beefy finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2015 Macán Clásico  (Rioja)
Winery: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA

Description: Blackberry aromas are accompanied by mild herbal notes and hints of baking spices. A full, ripe palate is anchored by grabby tannins, while this delivers a dark-fruit flavor profile with blackberry, vanilla, toast and wood spice notes. A finish with residual black-fruit power closes this out. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega 202 2015 Aistear  (Rioja)

Description: A dense nose with cool, earthy berry aromas feeds into a concentrated but hard palate with rocky tannins. Robust blackberry and dark plum flavors are supported by toasted oak, while the finish is bullish, tough and tannic. Expect a tussle getting through this. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2014 Macán  (Rioja)
Winery: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA

Description: Inky berry and plum aromas are ripe and concentrated, while this feels fully extracted, with grating tannins. Flavors of blackberry, prune and toasty oak are modern and lusty, while this is warm and chunky on a finish with mild burn. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Oscar Tobía Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark blackberry and black currant aromas come with a note of mint from ample oak. A well-balanced palate is fresh and crisp, with ripe black cherry, dark plum and cassis flavors. The finish on this live-wire crianza is tannic and rubbing, so serve with hearty food. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio Fournier 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A compact nose with blackberry and integrated oak aromas leads to a flush, round palate that's balanced and whole. Blackberry, black plum and cassis flavors are ripe and pleasing, with a touch of raw oak in support. An edgy finish with grating tannins suggests giving this as much air as possible before serving. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Gormaz 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of spice cake, prune and plum are backed by a palate with lifted acidity and firm tannins. Plum, currant and raspberry flavors have the support of light oak and a related cocoa accent. Drink this traditional Rioja through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Luis Gurpegui Muga 2014 Primi Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jammy blackberry aromas are woody and a bit loose, while this is quite full on the palate, with cheek-to-cheek tannins. Blackened oak and related lemony hints are the primary flavors, followed by toasty, peppery blackberry notes. Heat, edginess and grabby tannins on the finish need to settle. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Resalte 2016 Origen  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A balanced nose of black cherries, rosebuds and light mahogany show on the nose of this bottling from a biodynamic vineyard also known as Slide Hill. There's a flashy freshness to the sip, where light cherry and dried cranberry flavors meet with pepper and herbs, as acid rips into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Verdad 2017 Sawyer-Lindquist Vineyard Tempranillo (Edna Valley)

Description: Spicy, lightly herbal aromas of tomato leaf, tobacco and olive hint at modest reduction, while this feels rounded in weight yet cut by core acidity. Plum and berry flavors are common to Rioja, while vanilla and chocolate notes stem from background oak. A steady finish makes this an easy one to enjoy through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Ursa Maior Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blackberry, lightly charred oak and coffee aromas add up to nice whole. This crianza from a top vintage is medium to full in body, with racy acidity and depth. Toasty blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors are friendly, while a smooth finish with a touch of raisin culminates this very fine wine. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bardos 2016 Romántica Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Cassis and raisin aromas announce a fully ripe, warm-year reserva with enough acidic kick on the palate to ensure balance. Blackberry and baked plum flavors benefit from said acidity, while finishing notes of cured beef and baked berry fruits confirm that this a ripe-style Rioja. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Baked black-fruit aromas are raisiny and leathery, with notes of saddle and dried cheese. Fitting for a hot year like 2015, this Tempranillo-led blend feels full, dense and rich, but also baked and jammy. It's dry and tannic on the finish, with lasting notes of prune and blackberry. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2015 Baron de Chirel Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked cherry and caramelized berry flavors meet with leather, iron, caramel and dried flowers on the nose of this bottling. Fig paste, star anise and nutmeg flavors show on the rich and pleasant palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bolero Cellars 2017 Bella Collina Vineyard Reserve Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Blackberry aromas are accented by notes of cinnamon and spice cake in front of a lively palate with hard, dry tannins. Blackberry, toast and peppery spice flavors finish with heat and fire. This is a rocky, intense old-vines Tempranillo that doesn't tread lightly; let this breathe for best results.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cuerno 2016  Ribera del Duero

Description: Red-berry aromas of cassis and plum are a touch stalky and rustic, with a whiff of horseradish. A fresh palate is racy and medium bodied, while this reserva tastes of plum, cassis, vanilla and oak spice. Adequate length and a solid feel define the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2016 Cune Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Gritty aromas of peanut and asphalt are hard and capped. On the palate, this is full and well balanced. Jammy berry, vanilla, chocolate and savory flavors finish with a final blast of creamy oak. The longer this sits, the better it gets. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lealtanza 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Black plum and cassis aromas are ripe, friendly and a bit grapy. On the palate, this is big and braced by gangly tannins. Dark plum, blackberry and oak spice flavors are common to many modern Riojas, while this deals a touch of heat on a prodding finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2017 Ochenta  (Rioja)

Description: Meaty berry and dried plum aromas form an earthy nose that leads to a palate with good weight, concentration and acidity. Red plum and currant flavors benefit from integrated oak, while this reserva exhibits complexity via lightly herbal tomato notes on finish that otherwise pushes red-fruit character. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2016 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Familiar blackberry and black cherry aromas include touches of spice and herbal hints. This feels flush, pulpy and generally well balanced. Black plum and blackberry flavors finish juicy but with weight.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Peñalba Herraiz 2018 Aptus 8 Meses Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Fully ripe black-fruit aromas suggest prune and raisin, especially as this warm-year Tempranillo breathes and expands. A smacking palate with hard tannins is drying, while raspberry, blackberry and cassis flavors are full and ripeness. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campillo 2015 Reserva Selecta  (Rioja)

Description: Brandied berry and cherry flavors are a bit muddled and cheesy, while this reserva from a difficult vintage is clunky and grating. Plum and berry flavors are solid but flat as weighty tannins make for a heavy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Torres 2014 Altos Ibéricos Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy, smoky, slightly gritty red-berry aromas are austere and distant. On the palate, this is bright and acidic enough, if not a bit too much. Currant, red plum and tomato flavors remain snappy and tomatoey on a monotone finish that's all about being tight and bright.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Medievo 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked black cherry, root beer and caramel cream make for a very oaky nose on this bottling. The wood carries through the pleasantly rich sip, where smoked meat, grilled berry and nutty pecan flavors are framed by just enough tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2018 Chileno Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Herbal plum, spice and leather aromas are honest for a Rioja crianza, while this is medium in body with choppy tannins that smooth out with airing. Dry, spicy plum and berry flavors are light and foxy, with oak-based vanilla and cocoa notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Medievo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy black cherry and blackberry aromas are slightly herbal while showing a hint of animal. A full, wide palate is bulked up with pulpy fruit, while this tastes of mixed black fruits. A mildly baked character of prune limits the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valdaya 2018 El Valiente  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Tomatoey red-berry aromas hint at raisin while showing a blast of grainy oak. Punchy red-fruit acidity makes for a lively flavor profile that starts with vanilla and oak grain before shifting to dried plum and red cherry. Oak is the main flavor on a steady finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Hidalgo 2016 Tradición H  (Rioja)

Description: Leathery black plum and currant aromas include a note of vanilla on a mostly harmonious and familiar Rioja nose. This crianza feels juicy and solid. Plum, wild berry and mild oak flavors finish steady and direct, with smooth tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2017 Bordón Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Integrated aromas of flowers, berries and leathery spices are attractive and complex for value Rioja. A tight grip on the palate is mostly due to firm tannins, while this ripe-year reserva tastes of plum and oak spice. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kirkland Signature 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are a touch stalky and backed by oaky aromas and a whiff of road tar. This crianza is slightly grating and feels stretched out, with plum and berry flavors that fall a little short in the areas of finesse and elegance.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Torre de Oña 2017 Finca San Martín Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Mint and char lead a heavily oaked nose that barely allows room for fruit to express itself. A tight, crisp palate is austere and requires a lot of air. Oaky plum and currant flavors finish woody and scratchy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altanza 2016 Único12 Meses Roble Francés  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of herbal plum and berry fruits become more grapy the longer this sits. A saturated palate smacks with tannic grip and bold fruit. Blackberry and black plum flavors come with a brown sugar backing in front of a warm finish with grabby residual tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Aspaldi 2019 Cosecha  (Rioja)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is quite astringent, and those mouthdrying tannins seem to dominate right from the start. Other flavors bring tea, tobacco and vanilla, dried leaves and a core of tart pie-cherry fruit.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2016 Winemaker's Reserve Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Ripe berry aromas border on raisin and prune, while this feels chunky, acidic and tannic at the same time. Herbal blackberry, prune and savory oak flavors finish with a marinated quality. This is good gran reserva but it lacks elegance.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2011 Reciente Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This appears to be the current release as of late 2020 according to the winery website. Scents of hibiscus tea, dried rose petals and tart pie cherries lead into a pleasant, autumnal wine with softly mature flavors. Aged 23 months in a mix of French, American and Hungarian oak, the extra barrel and bottle time has muted any sharp edges from the wood, and the wine should be enjoyed over the near term.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cooper Ridge 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A Rocks District offering, the aromas bring notes of dried tobacco, dried orange rind and flower. The palate is a somewhat lighter, juicy style than the aromas would suggest.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: The Walls 2018 Wonderful Nightmare Stoney Vine Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: From the start, this reserva is tight and tough. Spiced cherry and currant aromas are distant, while this is high in acidity and thus crisp and lean. Tart plum flavors are backed by a hint of vanilla oak, while the finish is raw and racy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Aspaldi 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A strong earthy, peppery aroma leads to tight, smoky, tamarind flavors in this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bokisch 2017 Liberty Oaks Vineyard Tempranillo (Jahant)

Description: Candied plum and berry aromas are a touch soupy and gamy. On the palate, this is juicy and displaying ripping acidity and dry tannins. Cherry, black plum, currant and prune flavors are helped out on the finish by lasting acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campillo 2019 El Niño de Campillo  (Rioja)

Description: A heavy blast of forced grainy oak sits atop candied raisiny aromas in front of a palate with spiky acidity and resiny oak-based grab. Black currant and plum aromas are heavily oaked, leaving vanilla and graphite notes to linger on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Murky red-berry aromas are jammy, with a touch of green. This reserva from a less than ideal vintage feels flat and a little thick, with drying tannins. Plum and raspberry flavors are plodding through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Nueva 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Wiry berry aromas come with a strong note of animal hide, while this feels raw and grabby. Stalky berry aromas are slightly burnt and gritty, while herbal notes seal the character of this solid Tinto Fino.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Protos 2018 12 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Two bottles were tasted and the first was quite faded, almost flat. The second brought more up-front flavors of cranberry and cherry, with generous accents of coffee, vanilla and tobacco. The finish kicked in quickly with astringent, drying tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2016 Prayer Rock Vineyards Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Medicinal, earthy aromas of Band-Aid, latex, iodine and stewed plum set up a prodding palate with grabby tannins and punchy acidity. Murky blackberry flavors are backed by peppery spice and herbal notes, while dry tannins on the finish wrap things up.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bela 2018 Estate Grown  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Palpable oak aromas of vanilla and dill rest heavily atop soupy berry scents, while this is thick and rather heavy on the palate. Raisin, prune, vanilla and saucy berry fruit flavors are pinned down by oaky dominance, while a baked character softens the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luxus One 2018 Roble Singular Wine  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery's reserve-level red wines all show exceptionally dark colors and scents of vanilla, coffee and tobacco. Also common to all are extremely astringent tannins. The aging in half new oak also brings in vivid scents of cedar.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2017 Reserve Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

Description: Aromas of mixed berry fruits and dark plum come with notes of dried blood and cured beef. A tight and lively palate is driven by snappy acidity, while this leaner-style Rioja tastes of generic berry fruits and plum.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Covila 2019 Tinto  (Rioja)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of rust, fennel and balsamic berry show on the nose of this bottling. It's tart and tangy on the palate, with plum-skin and more fennel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bolero Cellars 2017 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Description: Stewed prune and raisiny flavors lead to a sticky palate that's flabby and heavy. Prune, spiced berry and barbecue sauce flavors lead to a flat finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carlos Serres 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This reserve blend of Paper Street and Denner vineyards, which spent 34 months in 100% new French oak, begins with intense aromas of roasted black currant, black cherry, coffee cream and asphalt. The palate is thick yet snappy with berry-like acidity, savory flavors of singed tobacco and roasted meat, and a cappuccino finish. The tannins are ready, but will last for years. Drink now–2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2017 Gran Reserva Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: In the series of single-variety wines from this producer, this wine is rich, generously and smoothly textured. Tinta Roriz, aka Tempranillo, gives a powerful, concentrated wine, with ripe black fruits and some fine potential. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Crasto 2016 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Description: Savory aromas of tobacco, bay leaf and beef stew meet abundant black-cherry and blackberry flavors in this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine. It has more than enough tasty fruit flavors to balance out the firm structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2018 The Heritage Collection Tempranillo (Lodi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bold, flavorful and firmly tannic, this full-bodied wine wraps dramatic toasted oak and grilled plum flavors in plenty of grippy tannins and has the concentration needed to keep it balanced. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vina Moda 2018 Tempranillo (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This is a charming Tempranillo from one of McLaren's Vale's consistently top-notch small producers. There's lovely purity of fruit—like fresh blueberries, cherries and plums—which mingle with aromas of cocoa nibs, cloves, violets and roses. On the medium-weight palate, an initial burst of juicy fruit is balanced by lithe tannins. Neatly composed, this avoids the flabbiness of many New World Tempranillo and instead offered bundles of charm and class.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Oliver's Taranga Vineyards 2018 Tempranillo (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: True to type, this full-bodied and extremely spicy wine contains plenty of tannins that give it an extra-grippy texture while complex earth, tobacco, leather and black-fig notes pile up on each other for a wonderful flavor fest. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2016 Estate Tempranillo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dense aromas of black plum, violet and blueberry are rich and unctuous yet not overextracted on the nose of this bottling. The wine is intense on the palate, where firm tannins framed thick blueberry compote and dark cracked pepper-spice flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2017 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from the newer Paper Street Vineyard, which includes 10% Carignan, begins with rich aromas of black cherry, caramel, cola and spearmint. The palate opens with ripe flavors of blueberry and blackberry, but then smoother leather and smoke flavors ride the chiseled tannins and penetrating acidity. Drink 2022–2037.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2017 Toro de Paso Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: This bold Rioja from a stellar vintage is quite potent and could use another five to 10 years in the cellar. Deep blackberry aromas are supported by lemony oak and char accents. A full-bodied palate has tannic bite and some heat to work through, while it tastes of blackberry, cassis and toasted oak. A high-octane finish confirms that this is a Tempranillo to drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Allende 2016 Mingortiz Single Vineyard Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are peppery and complex prior to a nicely layered palate with balancing acidity and depth. Dry oak lends notes of vanilla and cocoa powder to a flavor profile loaded with plum and berry fruit. A steady finish with vanilla oak notes holds onto juicy acidity that should allow this reserva from a fine year to show well through at least 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2016 Imperial Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry and plum aromas come with classic Rioja notes of vanilla, lemon peel and grainy oak. A full, plump and balanced palate brings weight and acidic cut, while this winner from a not-great year tastes spicy and oaky, with plum, berry, vanilla and tobacco flavors. A steady finish with mild snap and dryness is in cruise control; drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Aspaldi 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pleasant aromas of cola and baked boysenberrry meet with lavender and crushed lava rocks on the complex nose of this bottling, which includes 12% Syrah. The palate starts smooth on chiseled tannins that slowly turn leathery in texture, carrying flavors of blueberry, cracked pepper, oregano and wild thyme. Drink through 2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Hall 2018 Cavern Select Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Cedary berry and plum aromas show a touch of raisin along with lemony oak and vanilla notes. On the palate, bright acidity and firm tannins build to create a gripping mouthfeel, while this tastes of toasty oak, coffee with cream, plum and raspberry. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Edicion Limitada Single Vineyard Estate Bottled
Name: Mileto 2013 Edicion Limitada Single Vineyard Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Description: Tight-fisted plum and currant aromas are punchy, while this crianza from a great year excels across a lively palate. Spicy plum and currant flavors play out on a finish with cracked pepper notes and lingering acidity. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campillo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas come with a blackened note of crude oil and a blast of oaky char. This reserva from a warm year feels full but with sticky tannins. Ripe, pudgy flavors of prune, blackberry and chocolate end with baked fruit and charred oak notes on a lush finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Roda 2012 Roda I Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, prune and cassis come with side notes of tobacco and roasted nuts. This gran reserva is flush and full on the palate, with a bolt of acidity to aid balance and brightness. Deep plum and berry flavors are highly satisfying and finish smooth and round. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Hidalgo 2011 Tradición H Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Concentrated blackberry and cassis aromas lead to a full and intense palate. Toasty blackberry, cassis, vanilla and chocolate flavors are nothing unusual for this consistent producer, while this crianza feels warm and weighty but doesn't lose clarity on the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Elias Mora 2016 Crianza  (Toro)

Description: Baked berry aromas meld with raisin and prune on the nose. Edgy acidity lends punch to the palate, while this gran reserva from a cold and difficult year tastes of vanilla, plum, berry fruits and root beer. A hint of light oak infiltrates plum and cherry flavors on a standard finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2013 Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of blackberry sorbet, light cola, a touch of oak and a pinch of herbs all show on the nose of this bottling. Scorched blackberry and blueberry flavors cling to cement-like tannins on the sip, that need a touch of time to smooth out. Drink 2023–2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opaque 2018 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Appealing cherry and plum aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate, with acidity so juicy that this is racy in feel. Plum and currant flavors show some oak spice in front of a fresh finish that's clean and keeps the flow going in the right direction. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2016 Cincuenta  (Rioja)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This aromatic reserve shows a notch more concentration than the regular bottling, along with accents of dried herb and tomato leaf. There's soft plum and berry fruit flavors, lightly framed with citrus. The lingering finish brings additional highlights of vanilla and tobacco.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Coventina 2015 Reserve Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Vanilla and oaky coconut aromas soften lean berry scents in front of a flush palate with bright acidity and firm tannins. Plum, blackberry and oak flavors are integrated, while a long finish is dry in texture; drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luis Cañas 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe plum and cassis aromas are fully oaked and come with strong accents of graphite and vanilla. On the palate, this crianza is fleshy on the surface and creamy below deck. Lemony oak flavors give way to vanilla, while dark-berry fruit absorbs said oak. A fleshy, ripe finish never sheds plentiful oak; drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Val de Los Frailes 2016 Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A bright, plum and berry-flavored wine, with a pleasingly plump midpalate. Barrel aging has added lush mocha and toast flavors around polished, proportionate tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Coventina 2015 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Solid berry and cassis aromas are touched up by hints of sandalwood, baking spices and scented candle. A flush palate is lifted by snappy acidity and toughened by hard tannins. Cassis, raisin, caramel and vanilla flavors are flush on a finish with a bolt of acidity. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2016 Damana Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Big, broad and balanced, this offers a tasty mix of citrus and black cherry fruit with highlights of lightly tanned leather, smoke and tobacco. Though pushing toward 15% alcohol, it holds together well, with nice touches of barrel toast from aging in 20% new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Valcan 2016 El Torero Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Baked black-fruit and raisin aromas announce a ripe reserva from a hot but good year. Like the nose, this is rounded and full on the palate, and also a touch sticky. Spiced black plum, cassis and raisin flavors finish dense. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2012 Conde Valdemar Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Appealing aromas of baked berry fruits and plum lead to a full palate. Salty plum, raspberry, tomato and oak spice comprise a classic Rioja flavor profile, while this is lasting on the finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Berceo 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Floral berry aromas are light in weight and short on concentration, while this features the snap of sharp acidity on the lean palate. Plum and raisin flavors are limited in scope, with a finish that's lightly oxidized. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montecillo 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Appealing aromas of baked berry fruits and plum lead to a full palate. Salty plum, raspberry, tomato and oak spice comprise a classic Rioja flavor profile, while this is lasting on the finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Berceo 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Stewed black-fruit, cola and root-beer aromas are quite deep and inky on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with very extracted black-cherry and licorice flavors, leading into a very oaky, vanilla-laced finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Circle B 2017 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Standard berry aromas are fruity and touched up with oaky vanilla. A big and bulky palate is wayward in structure, while dark plum flavors are lightly herbal prior to a full finish that's shy on precision.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lealtanza 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This beefy-tasting and full-bodied wine boasts roasted fruit and toasted oak flavors riding a firm tannic texture. It's bold and savory but not overwhelming.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tinto Rey 2016 Estate Bottled Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: As in past vintages, this is blended with 9% Malbec and aged in mostly neutral oak. Light red fruits principally taste like red currants, with a hint of tart pie cherries. Aging 18 months in a percentage of once-filled barrels adds a gentle chocolate note as it fades.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2017 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Smoky oak-based aromas are backed by red-fruit notes of plum and currant. This crianza feels a bit grabby, while the same oak that leads the nose is notable along with plum and red-berry flavors. Tomato and oak spice flavors backed by dry tannins comprise the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are lean and fiery, a good indicator of the shearing palate that's coming. Tart currant and red plum flavors are borderline sour but should please fans of fresh red wines, while this is tangy and raw on a finish with a hint of charred oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2017 Cincuenta Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Heavy oak steamrolls this blend of 75% Tempranillo and 25% Merlot. The nose is earthy and oozing vanilla, while aromas of black plum and currant are raisiny. This is tannic, aggressive and drying on the palate, while a woody flavor profile that includes baking spices, prune, raisin and jammy blackberry is heavily oaked through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Balbas 2016 Ritus  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The Umpqua AVA is making a name for itself with this grape, but here the very light and generic red fruit is bathed in vanilla and mocha flavors. More fruit and less new oak would help to bring it back into balance.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: JosephJane 2017 Tempranillo (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A ripe berry aroma includes hints of raisin, graphite and vanilla. On the palate, this nearly 20-year-old Gran Reserva is still ripe, intense and exhibiting ample oak character. Dark flavors of blackberry and cassis are spiced up like fruitcake, while a powerful finish is full of warmth, vanilla and lingering berry fruit. Drink now–2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2001 12 Años Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A deep nose of spiced blackberry and balsamic aromas includes notes of lavender, tobacco and warm earth. Flavors of blackberry, cassis, toast, coffee and dark chocolate feed a long finish that hums with power and precision. It's sturdy yet pliable in structure, and could hold up for another 20 years. Drink through 2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2015 Torre Muga  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A black fruit aroma melds with a balsamic tone and a hint of road tar on the nose. The palate deals a forceful combination of tannins and acidity, while this Gran Reserva from a hot, dry year tastes of ripe black fruits backed by oak and vanilla. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2011 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe berry aromas teeter on raisiny desiccation but manage to stay upright and firm without losing clarity and freshness. This single-vineyard reserva from a warm year feels bold and dense while benefiting from popping acidity. Flavors of mocha, black coffee, dark berry fruits and prune finish with drying tannins and firm acidity that indicate that this has more good years ahead of it. Drink through 2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campillo 2015 Finca Cuesta Clara Raro Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Rich, ripe black fruit aromas are balsamic, smoky and stout. On the palate, this is bold but braced by core acidity. Blackberry, mocha and coffee flavors are supported by hard tannins and a kick of acidity, while this finishes with palpable ripeness and length. Expect the grate and grind of hard tannins to subside with further aging. Drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carlos Moro 2015 Viña Garugele  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smooth berry aromas are savory and offer a touch of tarry freshly laid asphalt. A deeply layered palate is rich in a chocolaty way, while flavors of blackberry, prune, oak spice and chocolate reflect a warm vintage (which 2009 was). A rounded and full finish is powerful yet balanced. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Arzuaga 2009 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe, balsamic aromas of saddle leather and mature black fruits lead to a saturated palate that's stacked with bold fruit and oak. Malty blackberry and prune flavors are backed by savory notes, while this old-vines Tempranillo doesn't let up on a long, warm finish. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Museum 2010 Numerus Clausus Gran Reserva Tinta del Pais (Cigales)

Description: Aged for 12 months in half French and half American oak, the wine is rich, immense and powerful. Licorice and spice show through the rich black fruits, structured tannins and concentration. This single-vineyard wine needs more aging, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2017 Vinha da Santa Maria Tinta Roriz (Beira Interior)

Description: Lusty aromas include blackberry, cassis, dark plum and licorice. On the palate, this warm-vintage reserva is lush and saturated in feel. Slightly desiccated berry flavors hint at prune, while toasty, chocolaty flavors enrich a bulky finish with rubbing tannins. Drink through 2034.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Roda 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: A dark color and fully ripe berry aromas that lean toward raisin open this plush and layered blend of Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Integrated acidity helps the mouthfeel and structure, while plum, blackberry and cocoa flavors finish with notes of prune and dark chocolate. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Río Negro 2014 5° Año Cogolludo- Guadalajara Serie Limitada Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: This small batch production wine is impressively rich and structured. The ripe tannins provide a bedrock for the black fruits and dark texture of a wine that needs to age. The wine has power and matching elegance. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Poças 2016 Fora da Série Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Description: A powerfully expressive interpretation of what is sometimes seen as the best grape for Douro wines. The wine is smooth and richly textured, and the tannins fully integrated into the wine's rich texture. Black plum and berry fruits show strongly in this still ageworthy wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Vallado 2017 Vallado Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe, earthy black fruit aromas work hard to maintain clarity and freshness, while this warm-year blend of Tempranillo, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Merlot is bolstered by juicy acidity and barrel-based tannins. Plum and currant flavors taste a bit woody, while this dries up quickly on a finish with rough cheek-rubbing tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Río Negro 2015 Cogolludo Guadalajara Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah-Merlot Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed granite and dried soil aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which also offers black-fruit scents. That stony quality envelops the palate, wrapping up the fresh black-currant and blackberry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Croma Vera 2018 Joven Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Balsamic aromas of tomato sauce and raisin set up a full palate with scratchy tannins and firm acidity. Raisin and plum flavors are bold but limited in scope and complexity, while this is flush on a finish with prune, cassis and chocolate notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mano A Mano 2016 Venta La Ossa Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Grainy American oak aromas of vanilla mixed with lightly spiced red fruit notes form a classic Rioja nose. A tight palate with wiry acidity is pointy as it delivers flavors of vanilla, dill, plum, red currant and wood spice. Oak is the prime player on the finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Coto 2015 Coto de Imaz Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is the fourth vintage of this wine from the producer's estate, the grapes farmed organically. Black pepper, garrigue and grippy tannins make for a meaty and substantial experience on the palate, punctuated by a lush and lasting blueberry flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled
Name: Marimar 2016 Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled Tempranillo (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A fully ripe and saturated nose hits hard with saturated blackberry, vanilla, coconut and raisin notes. A plush and jammy palate reflects a hot vintage, with hard tannins backing up. Blackberry and supporting oak flavors culminate on a dry as a bone finish that's woody tasting and tannic. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Legaris 2015 Páramos de Legaris  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Fully ripe berry aromas are heavily oaked and a bit fiery, but that's to be expected from Toro in a hot year like 2015. A ripe, dense palate delivers mocha, baked blackberry and peppery spice flavors, while the finish is a touch hot and heavy but mostly steady. Drink this ripe Tempranillo through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rompesedas 2015 Los Lastros Ancient Vines  (Toro)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Bold plum and currant aromas are spicy and show a note of licorice. This Tempranillo blend is flush but raw and biting, with severe tannic clamp. Concentrated cassis and cherry flavors are dark and spicy, while this reverts to dry, tannic and hot on a scratchy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tinedo 2016 Cala N°1 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Aromas of maple, cured meat, BBQ sauce and clove are firmly on the oaky side of the fence. This warm-year reserva is full in body but offers enough acidity so that it's balanced. Coconut, vanilla, nutmeg, plum and ripe berry fruit flavors finish with oaky cocoa and vanilla notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Leza García 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Exotic floral aromas blend with grittier, rougher notes on a nose that doesn't fit into what's normal for Rioja. An acidic palate is tomatoey and racy, while this tastes of punchy, acid-driven currant and red plum. A fresh but superficial finish is raw and racy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2011 Rivallana Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Herbal plum and tomato aromas include notes of dill and thyme. A classic Rioja palate with snap as well as depth offers racy plum and currant flavors backed by dill-laced oak. A slightly hot finish is the conclusion.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Palaciega 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Roasted berries, cola spice and charred beef aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 9% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2% Alicante Bouschet and 2% Syrah. It's full on the palate, with roasted meat, charred blackberry and black plum and a warming hint of baking spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cavaletti 2018 Tempranillo (California)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Youthful aromas of black fruits and dark plum are a touch jammy in front of a palate in which bright acidity gives this both teeth and energy. Spicy berry and dark plum flavors finish long but shallow. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valderiz 2018 Valdehermoso Joven  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Blackberry and black plum aromas are typical of warm-climate Tempranillo. On the palate, this is a little choppy and acidic but that means it's not a flat wine with no pulse. Cherry and berry flavors are solid in front of a healthy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Fernando Castro 2016 Valdemonte Roble Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Plum and berry aromas are a bit jammy, while a grapy mouthfeel features chewy tannins and just enough acidity. Blackberry and prune flavors finish with a note of raisin and a hint of soy sauce. This spent eight months in oak. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Arrocal 2018  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Slightly gritty aromas of black currant and black cherry set up a fresh palate that's choppy due to bold acidity. True Ribera del Duero flavors of blackberry and dark plum come with oak spice and peppery notes, while this is lively but steady on a finish that keeps the flow going.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca El Encinal 2018 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Punch bowl aromas of berry fruits and plum are simple and nonspecific but clean and welcoming. A juicy palate with pumped up acidity delivers short, punchy flavors of plum and blackberry that finish fresh but not complex.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rios de Tinta 2018  Ribera del Duero

Description: Raw oak and earthy berry aromas struggle to present a fresh, clean opening, while this hot-year reserva is highly acidic and shearing on the palate. Oaky plum and vanilla flavors reflect 24 months in barrel, while this is scratchy feeling and tastes baked on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Museum 2015 Reserva Tinta del Pais (Cigales)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty cherry and black plum aromas come with a blast of asphalt. The palate on this Tempranillo is rough and short on body. Stalky dark-plum flavors are matched by a taste of burnt leaf, while the finish is peppery tasting and tannic as a box of nails.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sinfonía 2017 Vintage Collection Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: A compact nose doesn't smell like a whole lot, while this standard Tempranillo is fairly chunky and beefy on the palate. A slight note of green blends into core flavors of sugar beet, black plum and black currant, while this holds its form on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2017 Protocolo Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked berry aromas are hot and leathery, while this warm-year crianza feels grabby and tannic. Black fruit flavors are spicy and desiccated, while clenching tannins make for an edgy finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Áster 2015 Crianza Estate Bottled  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Black cherry and plum aromas are a touch gritty and stalky, while this ordinary Toro is lively on the palate. Standard black fruit flavors are limited, while this is initially jumpy on the finish before it loses steam and goes flat.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viore 2019  Toro

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Balsamic berry, prune and earth notes open this sappy, jammy RDD that's hot and burning on the palate. Baked berry flavors are green in the middle, while this tastes minty and feels dryly tannic on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Convento Oreja 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Jammy berry aromas are intense in front of a saturated palate that's weighty but clumsy. Blackberry flavors are sort of flat and hot, while this is grapy on a lumbering finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Soledad 2018 Solmayor Tempranillo (Uclés)

Description: A heat-baked nose oozes raisiny aromas of prune and chocolaty oak. A syrupy palate is sticky, while this is flooded with oaky black fruit flavors backed by a woody finish with clove notes. Pass if you are seeking freshness and flow.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Fernando Castro 2015 Raices Crianza Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

Description: Baked aromas of prune and blackberry announce a lifeless palate. Stewy berry flavors are backed by an odd savory note akin to ketchup, while this is dull and tannic on the back end.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campos Reales 2017 Canforrales Selección Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Dry oak aromas are the greeting, and this smells earthy and cheesy in a classical way; along with that, this offers ripe scents of raisiny berry fruits and vanilla. A full palate is rich while holding on to its balance. Flavors of balsamic plum, berry fruits and tobacco finish bold more than fine and elegant. Drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Rioja Alta 2012 Viña Arana Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy dark-berry aromas come with complex side notes of tobacco and licorice root. A healthy palate is medium rich and slightly chocolaty, with balsamic berry, savory herb and spice flavors. A smooth finish echoes back to tobacco. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baigorri 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A rusty color and classic Ardanza aromas of dry spice, fallen leaves, charred beef, tobacco and herbs announce a proprietary Rioja. Typical raciness and blazing acidity drive the palate, while spicy red berry and currant flavors are backed by dry oak. Only on the finish does this soften, with a hint of raisin coming out. Drink now through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Rioja Alta 2010 Viña Ardanza Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry, vanilla and dried cheese aromas are moderately complex and true to traditional Rioja. A full, fleshy palate is balanced by red fruit acidity, while plum, berry and oak flavors are ripe to the point that you can find a touch of raisin if you dig deep. A warm, fully ripe finish is par for the course. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Black plum and cassis aromas are ripe but monotone. On the palate, this warm-vintage gran reserva feels lush and fruity, but vaguely defined. Black plum, oak and balsamic reduction are the flavor ingredients, while this feels smooth, pulpy and easygoing on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campillo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas are locked up out of the gate, opening to reveal notes of fresh tobacco, moist earth, orange rind and cherry. The palate has a pleasing sumptuousness to the mouthwatering earth, savory, olive and citrus flavors. The texture is lovely.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cayuse 2017 Impulsivo En Chamberlain Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: Balsamic berry fruit aromas are appropriate for a warm year like 2012. This is bullish and tannic, and definitely riper than most vintages of Monte Real gran reserva. Plum and prune flavors stay giant on a tannic finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2012 Monte Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bursting with dense flavors of black cherries and dark chocolate, this big bold wine, despite its high alcohol, keeps itself in proper proportion.
