Notes of warm spices add interest, and the grainy textured tannins contribute further length. It was barrel aged for two years in 40% new French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2016 Tempranillo (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: A supple nose is loaded with ripe black-fruit aromas that accurately reflect a warm vintage. A thick palate is tannic and on the heavy side, again reflective of the year. Blackberry, plum and toast flavors remain on stage through a dry finish with simmering tannins. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas explode from the glass, with notes of sweet pipe tobacco, fire pit, black-olive tapenade, cherry, orange peel and earthy funk. The palate is more reserved than the aromas would suggest and brings a real sense of mouthwatering freshness and restraint to the savory flavors. A long finish caps it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: No Girls 2017 Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: Ripe, spicy black cherry and other black fruit aromas are aggressive but not unrestrained. This crianza sports a healthy body driven by bold fruit and punchy acidity. Fully ripe berry and black plum flavors finish with mild oak notes that suggest chocolate. This is steady like a metronome and very well balanced. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2016 Royal Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Mild reduction on the nose leaves room for earthy plum and berry scents as well as floral aromas. This reserva from a great vintage is lively and juicy on the palate, with rubbing tannins that should soften in short order. Cherry, cassis and wood spice flavors finish dry and firm, with residual red fruit notes. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Jammy berry aromas are slightly candied and fluffy, while this is plump on the palate, packed with fruit and balanced by mellow tannins. Deep plum and berry flavors show a fair amount of spicy oak, while this is full and a touch chocolaty on the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Medievo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Pago de Arínzano, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas are matched by oak-based notes of coffee and chocolate. An intense palate brings power but also balance, while this Pago-specific Tempranillo tastes of toasty berry, cassis, dark chocolate and vanilla. A rich and heady finish is the conclusion. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Arínzano 2016 Hacienda de Arínzano Tempranillo (Pago de Arínzano)

Description: Smooth, ripe black fruit aromas are earthy and a touch spicy, but mostly just comfortable and clean. On the palate, this crianza narrows a bit and displays a grabby, choppy side. Flavors of spicy plum and berry fruits are dusted with cocoa hints, while this is dry and mildly tannic on the finish. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Lightly stewed aromas of ripe berry fruits and prune are a bit dull, while this feels plump, dense and anchored by scratchy tannins. Baked berry flavors transition to a chocolaty finish with savory black plum and prune notes. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Nueva 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Plum and berry aromas meld with oak spices on the nose. Bright acidity creates lift on the palate, with spicy black fruit and toasty oak flavors filling it out. Drink now through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2014 Rioja Bordón Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Plum and berry aromas fill out the nose on this rugged reserva from a marginal vintage. The palate is quite lifted in acidity, with plum and herbal berry flavors filling it out. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2014 Royal Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This young red, done in a Beaujolais Nouveau style, is principally Tempranillo, with 9% Tinta Cao. Scents of freshly baked bread rise from the glass, followed by fresh and lightly fruity flavors of tangy cranberries. This lovely wine is a perfect fit for a Thanksgiving feast, or anytime a light and lively red wine is wanted.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2019 Tinto Joven Tempranillo (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Gritty, earthy berry aromas are not exuberant but do the job of getting you primed to drink this solid crianza from an excellent vintage in Rioja. An edgy palate is full and features rubbing tannins, while roasted berry and plum flavors finish in down the middle fashion.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Subdued black plum and cassis aromas are jammy and show a whiff of cheesy oak. The palate is a touch fiery and prickly, but airing is the tonic it needs. Standard RDD flavors of black fruits, spice and toasty oak finish steady, with no major changes from before.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Loess 2016 Inspiration  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy cherry, plum and berry aromas come with a floral note and a hint of orange peel. A prodding palate is far from shy, while this crianza tastes of plum and berry fruits and oak-based vanilla. Oak remains out front on a finish that's fresh and lifted.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Launa 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Forget the normal criteria for Rioja crianza, because this isn't light in fruit, weight or oak. Just the opposite: The nose is concentrated, dark and a touch raisiny, with overt oak aromas. A full palate is cut by healthy acidity, while this is packed with blackberry and chocolate flavors. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nubori 2016 Edición Limitada Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Herbal red berry aromas are spicy and hint at desert herbs. Creamy oak on the palate means this feels a bit thick, while spicy oak and plum flavors finish with clove and other baking spice notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Latitud 42 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Jammy berry aromas come with a candied note of raspberry. Like the nose, this feels jammy and a touch sticky. Ultraripe berry flavors push toward raisiny, while this is mild on a finish without much charge to it. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nubori 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Soft berry aromas are mellow but a touch flat and overripe. A dense palate feels a bit heavy, while ripe, toasty black fruit flavors lead to a spicy finish that's plump and weighty. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Conde Valdemar Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Herbal red berry aromas are spicy and hint at desert herbs. Creamy oak on the palate means this feels a bit thick, while spicy oak and plum flavors finish with clove and other baking spice notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Latitud 42 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Earthy berry aromas along with toasted bread crust and charred scents lead to a big, tannic palate. Oak is prominent alongside a touch of green herbs. Residual oak and grippy tannins carry the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2016 Parada de Atauta  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Though labeled simply Oregon, this is all Umpqua Valley fruit, aged in a mix of barrels and larger casks for 18 months. It's soft and approachable, with dark fruits mixing mulberry and cassis. A vein of green coffee beans runs through the drying tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Oregon Territory 2017 Tempranillo (Oregon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of cherry, wood spice and slightly sour tar start the nose of this bottling. The palate combines black plum, potting soil, crushed rocks and a leather element, leading into a toasty vanilla finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Croma Vera 2017 Maduro Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy blackberry aromas are topped with a coating of vanilla oak and creaminess. On the palate, this is fairly juicy and racy, with fresh acidity. Standard RDD black fruit flavors are backed by milk chocolate and spice notes, while this doesn't change, improve or evolve on a straight-line finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Conde de Siruela 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe, earthy black fruit aromas come with notes of cumin, stewed plum and campfire smoke. The palate on this is full and deep, but not well plotted. Chocolaty oak and smoke partially cover green notes in the fruit, while this is fierce on a finish stacked with smoldering oak and tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lealtanza 2012 Club Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fiesta is Abacela's entry level bottling. It's fresh and fruity, with a chewy grainy texture. Flavors are front loaded, bringing blackberry fruit along with streaks of espresso and dark chocolate. The tannins push through a quick, drying finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abacela 2017 Fiesta Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A warm, malty nose features maple, prune and balsamic aromas. A widespread palate is tannic, fleshy and a bit hot, while lively acidity is a surprise that adds zest to dark plum and black currant flavors. Woody spice notes and cheek-grabbing tannins control the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Emina 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A sturdy wine, this focuses on red-cherry flavors and slightly grainy chewy tannins. There's a faint hint of volatility that quickly blows off, and the wine finishes clean. Drink now and through the middle of the decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pebblestone 2015 Ellis Vineyards Block 7 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Generous and fruity, this medium-bodied wine sports a bowl full of fresh peach and raspberry flavors on a smooth soft texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Matchbook 2019 Estate Bottled Rosé of Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are far out front, with notes of char, toast and freshly hewn wood. The fruit flavors are lighter styled, unable to stand up to the oak. Vanilla notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stottle 2015 6 Prong Vineyard Tempranillo (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Lush black fruit aromas push the limits of ripeness but pull back to show additional complexity, depth and potential for midterm aging. Saucy acidity is perfect for a big-boned red like this. Black plum, cassis and berry flavors are lightly herbal and savory, while this high flyer is impressively balanced to the end. Simply put: This is a spectacular modern Rioja to enjoy through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Roda 2016 Cirsion  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas set up a palate with plush tannins and layers of depth. Befitting a hot year like 2011, dark berry and plum flavors are full, while this exhibits fine shape on the finish and only gets better the longer it sits. This is no doubt a delicious Rioja from one of the top wineries in Spain. Decant if drinking now. Enjoy through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2011 Prado Enea Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A fully ripe nose runs deep with balsamic black fruit aromas as well as complex notes of graphite and fine oak. A plush palate offers that elusive depth of character that great wines display, while this modern-style Rioja tastes of black fruits as well as chocolate. A silky smooth finish shows barely any grit or bite. Drink now through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2016 Dalmau  (Rioja)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A profusion of tobacco, cedar, earth and leather aromas leads to rich and concentrated black-cherry, cranberry and grilled plum flavors in this medium- to full-bodied and firmly structured wine. Plenty of fine-grained tannins add fullness and grip, while the wine's intensity carries over to a lingering finish. Best from 2022–2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2015 Christian's Reserve Tempranillo (Lake County)

Description: Ripe, smooth plum, prune and spice aromas include notes of tobacco and vanilla. While this gran reserva is a touch active and choppy, that's good in that it's not close to tiring. Spiced berry, mocha, and tobacco flavors are backed by a toasty finish that's still lively and cranking. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Hidalgo 2010 Tradición H Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy berry and creamy oak aromas are thorough and pleasing from the start. On the palate, this is lively, full and fresh, with a hint of choppiness. Berry, plum and lavender flavors finish with good density, balance and residual flavors of raisin and plum. For Marqués de Vargas, this is a new peak. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2012 Gran Reserva Hacienda Pradolagar  (Rioja)

Description: Classic Rioja aromas of graphite, cherry, plum and oak are lightly toasted and spicy. On the palate, this offers chewy depth and impeccable balance. Ripe, heady plum, cassis and berry flavors are also nuanced and elegant, while this gran reserva from a ripe vintage tastes of vanilla and mild oak on the finish. For an affordable high-quality gem, look no further. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Coto 2012 Coto de Imaz Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Tight, oaky blackberry and black olive aromas include a note of asphalt in front of a thick, dense palate that shows acidic cut and fine overall balance. Savory oak flavors are grainy on top of black fruit and coffee flavors. On the finish, this tastes of toast, vanilla and butter. Best 2022–2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Landaluce 2016 Capricho de Landaluce  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe blackberry, cola and oaky vanilla aromas are lush and ooze quality. A ramped-up palate is intense but in fine shape, while black-plum, blackberry and black-cherry flavors sizzle with energy on bucking finish that portends many good years to come; drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Legón 2016 Premium  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A slightly wiry nose offers vanilla and integrated oak aromas along with spice, plum and cherry notes. On the palate, this Tempranillo from outside the Ribera del Duero confines is lush and mostly pure, with blackberry, cassis, wood-spice and cocoa flavors. The finish, that's both generous and elegant, tastes of mocha and berry fruits. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Azaya 2012 Premium Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Classic Rioja aromas of vanilla, spice, tobacco and dried berry fruits carry this wine. On the palate, this warm-vintage gran reserva has energy from well-stored acidity, while the flavors include cherry, plum, mocha and a plethora of spices. Chocolate and tobacco flavors along with general warmth crowd the finish. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2009 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Upfront toasty oak gives this a lemony aromatic note that transitions to char. A pulpy palate is packed with fruit, while this tastes of blackened oak along with ripe berry fruits and wood spice. Spice notes are maintained on a dry finish with lasting oak. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cillar de Silos 2016 Torresilo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Dense plum, berry and spice aromas are compact and full of intensity on the nose. A full, lush and tannic palate has a stout structure, while plum, berry, oak and savory spice flavors finish with vanilla, tobacco and firm tannins. It needs time to reach its peak. Drink this excellent gran reserva from a lauded vintage through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Beronia 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of oak, coconut and graphite meet a core of blackberry, plum and graham cracker on the nose. This is not your average crianza—it's more strapping and power-packed—with dark, toasty flavors of blackberry and mocha. Drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark-fruit aromas of blackberry and plum are oaky but not adulterated, while a saturated palate is jammy but lively enough to shine. Plum, cherry and fleshy blackberry flavors cover the dark-fruit gamut, while this is stout and packed in on a powerful finish. Drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2012 6 Años Reserva Premium  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Grainy oak aromas lend aged cheese and balsamic notes to the nose, while this feels fresh, tough and tight. Charred oak and related toast notes back cherry, plum and cassis flavors, while this is long and steady on a seamless finish. Best 2021–2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tr3smano 2016  Ribera del Duero

Description: Pure berry fruit aromas are classy from the start. On the palate, this is smooth and easy, not hard, tannic or demanding. Black plum, currant and oaky vanilla flavors finish with moderate acidity, freshness and snap. Drink this tasty Rioja through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Leizaola 2016 Caminos De Sacramento  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are oaky and include a note of woody vanilla. On the palate, this is tight and has a resiny texture from extended barrel aging. Oak-heavy flavors of vanilla and berries finish with chocolate and a medicinal hint. Drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Latitud 42 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Inviting plum and berry aromas are supported by oak and dusty earth notes, while this is ripe (15% abv) and generous on the palate, with a healthy blend of grainy tannins and acidity. Oak-aided berry flavors run long on the finish. Drink or hold; this will be best come 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2016  Ribera del Duero

Description: Earthy berry and plum aromas come across as mature but not old, with meaty accents. The palate on this barrel-selected gran reserva is layered and filled out by generous tannins. Flavors of prune, raisin, cassis and blueberry are filled out well by oak tones, but not overpowered. This warm-vintage gran reserva feels smooth on the finish; drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montecillo 2011 22 Barricas Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy black fruit aromas are warm and ripe. Befitting a reserva from a hot year like 2015, this is big-bodied and flush, with flavors of toasty oak, chocolate and mixed berry fruits. Ripeness is not lost on a finish with mild heat. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2015 Reserva Unfiltered  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A warm balsamic essence along with dark plum and berry scents push the nose on this Tinto Fino. Scrubbing tannins are out front on a healthy palate, while this pops with dark berry flavors and toasty oak. A steady finish shows power and youthful energy, so drink now or hold through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Portia 2018 Prima  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A warm, soft and oaky nose, with berry fruit and earth notes, opens this wide load with a fleshy body. Wild berry and blueberry flavors are plump and just lively and snappy enough on a generous finish. This is about fruit and softness, not structure or elegance. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Barón de Traus NV Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Spicy red-berry aromas are a bit reedy and piquant, which makes sense when you arrive at a fresh, vibrant palate, with peppy acidity. Plum, raspberry and strawberry flavors are accented by wild herb notes, and only on the finish does this show a riper note of prune and some oak. Drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Ontañón 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A smooth nose of spicy blackberry melds with accents of dried cheese and vanilla. On the palate, this is muscular and a bit fleshy. Plum, spice and berry flavors finish with power and purpose; drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campillo 2012 Reserva Selecta Tempranillo  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Charred oak speaks loudest on a nose that fluctuates between clean and fruity and pointed and staunch. A choppy palate relaxes with airing, while this tastes of oaky berry fruits. On the finish, this reverts to woody, hard and tannic. Revisit this between 2022 and 2024 and it should be calmer and nicer to drink.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Emilio Moro 2016 Malleolus  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: It's wines such as this that continue to elevate the reputation of Southern Oregon Tempranillo. Subtle and sexy, this intrigues with scents of cedar, tobacco and soft leather. In come flavors of plum and cherry, yielding a complex and detailed wine that puts a focus on finesse over power.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Naumes 2016 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas are backed by strong oak that yields a touch of clove. A deep and layered palate is balanced and mostly fresh, which aids a full-bodied Tempranillo such as this. Black-plum, cassis and spice flavors finish with savory complexity. This is a big ripe offering to drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alidis 2012 VS  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of baked blueberry and prune on the nose reflect the hot, dry vintage. The solid palate brings dense berry and plum flavors that show a touch of raisin prior to a fruit-laden finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2012 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry aromas come with notes of licorice root, dark chocolate and baking spices. The palate on this warm-year reserva is packed with jammy weight and smooth tannins, while this tastes of blackberry, prune and toasty oak. Apropos for a ripe Tempranillo, this is full on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Obalo 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Winemaker: Warren Ellis. Sourced from the Bottelary region of Stellenbosch, there's an attractive savory, herbal character to this wine, with pronounced notes of green pepper, tomato leaf and a touch of cigar ash on the nose. The palate is medium in weight, but quite mouthfilling and firmly structured in strong yet fine tannins and a lingering green-wood impression that, again, manages to come off as attractively balanced and surprisingly enticing. Light red-plum and cherry-pit tones lend fruity accents to the palate.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Neil Ellis 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Amper Bo Tempranillo (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Charred aromas of burnt wood, black coffee and tire rubber give way to smoky fruit. This is a tannic, tough Tempranillo, one that's pinched in feel. Charred blackberry flavors remain dark on a chewy tannic finish. Give this lots of air or more time in bottle; drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Protos 2012 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: An intense mix of graphite, asphalt, tobacco and blackberry aromas is ripe but positive, while this feels more gritty and narrow than elegant. Baked black-fruit flavors are bolstered by chocolate and coconut notes, while this is peppery but also pruney on a bold finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valdelacierva 2014 Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All of the Tempranillo for this wine comes from StoneTree Vineyard on the Wahluke Slope, with a dash (13%) of Cabernet Sauvignon from Dionysus on the White Bluffs. Aged in 30% new French oak, bringing out aromas offering notes of vanilla, sweet spice, fresh tobacco and cherry. Smooth sinewy flavors follow, sprinkled with ample barrel spicing. It's a compelling offering of this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2017 Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas drift in the direction of prune and raisin, while this is hot and slightly edgy on the palate. Black plum and cassis flavors come with chocolaty oak before this hollows out on the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2016  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: An opaque-black color and huge aromas of concentrated black fruits, oak, coconut and vanilla open this saturated hard-pusher that's both plush and hard as granite. Blackberry, mocha and coffee flavors finish with smoke, toast and grainy oak notes. Drink through 2033.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Trus 2016 Pico de Luyas  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Berry and cassis aromas are supported by vanilla and oak grain scents, while this is made lively by lemony acidity. A full spectrum of flavors ranges from red plum and currant to wild berry, while oak comes in later on and controls a finish with vanilla, salt and dill notes. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Leza García 2016 LG  (Rioja)

Description: Smooth plum and berry aromas are easy to appreciate, while this feels really good on the palate due to a comfortable interplay between lushness and lasting acidity. Plum, berry fruit and oak spice flavors run long on a healthy finish. Drink through 2029.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montecillo 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A fully oaked nose leads with vanilla and chocolate aromas, while spiced berry-fruit notes lurk in the background. This is lively on the palate, with bold acidity and grabby tannins. Oaky, spicy flavors of berry fruits and vanilla finish with mocha richness and dry tannins. Drink this honest RDD Crianza through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Resalte 2015 Lecco Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe blackberry aromas hint at prune but don't signal anything overripe. Tartaric acidity is lifted and lends focus to the palate. Surface-level black fruit flavors include a note of cured meat, while this feels a bit hot on a finish with chocolaty oak leftovers.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Legado de Orniz 2015 Triens  (Toro)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Warm, earthy berry aromas require airing to clean up after first coming across as cheesy and rustic. A medium-bodied palate is mature while still showing some tannic scratchiness. Plum and berry flavors are settled, and a modest finish indicates that this Tempranillo is at its peak. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Verum 2011 Reserva Familiar Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Berry and plum aromas are earthy and ripe, with notes of spice, vanilla and oak grain filling out the nose. On the palate, this warm-vintage Crianza feels bold and fairly acidic. Quick-hitting flavors of currant, red plum and vanilla fade out on a fresh finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baigorri 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Opulent is a rebranding for Chateau Bianca's Obsidian label. Among the current releases, this is the most balanced, with rich black cherry, cola and sandalwood scents and flavors. It's a dark, deep, smoky wine that's lushly spiced. It should be consumed over the next couple of years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Opulent 2014 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: A full, ripe nose comes with raisin and berry notes, while this warm-year gran reserva is braced with high acidity that creates freshness and rip on the palate. Raspberry, plum and mild oak flavors go the distance on an energetic finish. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rioja Vega 2011 Reserva 135 Anniversario  (Rioja)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral aromas and bold black-cherry flavors give this full-bodied wine plenty of impact. From a consistently good Sierra Foothills winery, it is robust, ripe, rich and well rounded in texture, too.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Miraflores 2016 Estate Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Rich, heady aromas of tobacco, vanilla and ripe berry fruits border on jammy. On the palate, this is thick and extracted, with the full weight of what Ribera del Duero can bring. Creamy oak and tobacco flavors are spicy but not directly fruity, while on the finish this remains rich to the point that it's almost too much. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2010 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Deep berry, prune and maple aromas are warm and balsamic as they border on overripe. A thick, creamy palate reflects a hot vintage, while this reserva tastes chocolaty, with herbal berry fruit and spice notes. A round, almost sticky finish is built on grabby tannins. This is a very full and ripe Rioja.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Resiny oak aromas meld with rose hip, cherry and spice notes on the nose. This crianza is built by firm tannins on the palate, with cherry and prune flavors that lead to a solid finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Nueva 2015 Crianza.15  (Rioja)

Description: A salt-and-pepper spiciness is backed by very ripe and satisfying plum and blackberry flavors in this full-bodied wine. It is bold and mouthfilling, showing moderate tannins to balance the ripe fruit character.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Harney Lane 2016 Tempranillo (Lodi)

Description: Earthy aromas of savory black fruits and black olive lead to a full and tannic palate that's a bit rough. Toasty, slightly burnt berry flavors finish firm but short, with hard tannins and grit. For a 2012 gran reserva, this is on key but doesn't shine.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rioja Vega 2012 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Warm, oaky aromas of maple and cocoa blend with dark-berry-fruit scents. On the palate, this is lively and punchy but nothing special or unusual for a Ribera Crianza. Snappy plum and berry flavors include spice notes, while this tastes of desiccated plum and chocolate on the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altos de Valdoso 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A dense nose with cola, lemony oak and vanilla notes sets up a bulky, ripe palate with raisiny weight. Ripe black-fruit flavors are jammy and accented by vanilla, while this remains oaky on a ripe finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are warm, mossy and earthy, with oaky support. A full, fleshy palate is firmed up by solid tannins, while this tastes of black plum, berry fruits and savory spices. A medium-length finish is chewy and ripe. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Excellens Cuvée Especial  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of stalky berry fruits, herbs and sea shell improve little by little with airing. This is full, chewy and plump on a palate, with modest acidity. Berry, cassis and chocolaty oak flavors thicken up on a dense finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio del Soto 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe berry aromas meander towards desiccated plum and cassis. Staying with that theme, this feels plump and fleshy, with blackberry and barrel-spice flavors that are well integrated. A sappy and pulpy feeling finish tastes of vanilla and chocolate.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Larchago 2012 Reserva Edición Fábulas  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Reduced aromas of gritty berry fruits and rubber need all the air they can get. A tannic palate is tight and tough, with flavors of baked plum that run hot and heavy. A scratchy tannic finish brings this hard and tannic Tinto Fino to a close.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Atalayas de Golbán 2015 Torre d'Golbán Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Blackberry and blueberry aromas are full and spicy like pie. This Toro is big and extracted, with road-grating tannins. Toasty, blackened berry flavors are ripe and rugged, while this is ramming in feel and toasty in flavor on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Teso La Monja 2017 Romanico  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A beefy, brothy nose is stewy and dense, with none of the elegance and comfort that great wines should show. Instead, this is big and saturated on the palate, with raisin, baked berry and stewed flavors. Gummy weight and chocolaty flavors fuel a rich finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alidis 2012 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Cherry and berry aromas include spice and oak notes. For a ripe year, this Crianza is as expected in terms of mouthfeel, meaning it's full but also fresh. Salty plum, red-currant, tomato-leaf and oak-spice flavors finish steady, with a lasting tomato-sauce note.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tarón 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Baked berry and spice aromas are piercing and lack purity, which can happen in a hot vintage like 2015. Choppy acidity on a tight palate frames cherry, raspberry and juicy plum flavors, while this runs long and hot on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Primicia 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy, slightly exotic aromas are unusual and suggest blueberry and tea. In the mouth, this is widespread and saturated. Grapey flavors are heavy and include a helping of toast, while this is dry, chewy and tannic on a finish that hints at oxidation.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valenciso 2012  Rioja

Description: Fresh cut firewood and steak tartare aromas meet tart cranberry and red currant on the nose. These tones echo on the palate, supported by black pepper and oak flavors. Soft, velvety tannins and lean acidity create a well rounded and balanced structure.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Snowy Peaks 2016 Tempranillo (Grand Valley)

Description: Racy currant, cranberry and lemon-peel aromas are low on depth and darkness, while this feels zesty on the palate, with acidity fueling things. Spicy, oaky red-plum flavors stay fresh on a crisp, acidic finish that's rough and rugged.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rioja Vega 2014 Reserva Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Description: Woodsy aromas meld with stalky berry and plum scents prior to a pulling, tannic palate with bold acidity. Herbal berry flavors are pumped up by lemon acidity, while this shows fiery spirit along with berry flavors that finish with prune notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Valpiedra 2015 Cantos de Valpiedra  (Rioja)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This small-production wine is rich and complex, starting with leather, tobacco and cherry in the nose, and plenty of fruit flavor on the palate, supported by a velvety texture formed by fine-grained tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wise Villa 2016 Estate Tempranillo (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Reedy red fruit aromas suggest currant backed by a slight chemical oak note. A round, pulpy palate is inexact, while this tastes of oaky berry and plum in front of a woody finish. Tempranillo with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Gracida 2011 Gran Reserva Red (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stalky aromas of brambly black fruits are dark, earthy and a little soupy, maybe a reflection of the high heat that defined 2015. Gravelly tannins make for a dry mouthfeel, while oaky, stalky berry flavors remain woody on a tannic finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casajús 2015 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Cherry, plum and spice notes come with a touch of oak. A fresh palate with proper weight and grip tastes of spicy black fruits and plum prior to a clean finish. This may not be special, but it's right for everyday drinking.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Eguía 2018  Rioja

Description: Stalky aromas are gritty, while this Tempranillo feels creamy at the edges but otherwise closed. Spicy, leafy berry flavors are earthy and basic, while this finishes short. Tempranillo with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Albali 2012 Selección Privada Gran Reserva Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Leather and sunbaked earth aromas waft from this medium- to full-bodied wine followed by red-cherry and sour cherry flavors on a lightly tannic texture. The wine has attractive nuances and it's not too heavy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Boeger 2017 Tempranillo (El Dorado)

Appellation: Vinos de Madrid, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Plum and minty green notes lead to a full palate made jagged and rugged by hard, grinding tannins. This Tempranillo blend from the Madrid region tastes of blackberry, dark plum and oak-related spices and chocolate. A smacking, edgy finish is generous but rough.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Regajal 2016 Las Retamas Red (Vinos de Madrid)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark-berry aromas are extracted and grapey but easy to process. On the palate, this feels fully extracted, with rough tannins and a hint of vinegar. Grapey blackberry and dark-plum flavors are short in front of a tannic finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altos de Valdoso 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Gritty aromas of herbs, earth and berry fruits lead to lean palate with sharp acidity. Red plum and currant flavors don't have much to say on a finish that feels slightly hot and edgy. This is largely Tempranillo with Cabernet blended in.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Albali 2010 Gran Reserva de Familia Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

Description: Dry, spicy berry aromas are typical of Navarran and Riojano Tempranillo, while this feels crisp and racy, with a chalky mouthfeel. Snappy currant and plum flavors come with mild spice notes backed by an acid-driven finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Manzanos 2018 111 Tempranillo (Navarra)

Description: Earthy spice notes accent basic berry aromas, while this feels grabby and medium in body. Generic berry and plum flavors finish quickly, with choppy, dry residual tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Palacio del Burgo 2018 Tinto  (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of macerated cranberry, white pepper and currant lead to quite smoky-seeming flavors with a citrusy finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Masset Winery 2016 Tempranillo (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty berry aromas come in front of a clampy palate that's acidic then tannic and ultimately empty. Chunky berry and vanilla flavors struggle to stay steady on a finish that doesn't improve or devolve.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matanegra 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Forced oak and resiny aromas give this a chemical note of tire rubber on the nose. The palate is sizable but unruly, with oaky weight and a resiny feel to go with flavors of coconut, vanilla, mocha and woody berry fruits. Roughness and oak are outsized on this Ribera Tempranillo.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Portia 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Generic black fruit and spice aromas are slightly leafy, while this feels hard on the palate, with smacking tannins. Plum, berry and spice flavors make the grade, and on the finish this Tempranillo is dry, tannic and scratchy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2018 El Circo Volatinero Tempranillo (Cariñena)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oaky berry aromas are accompanied by herbal notes and dry brush scents. This is plump and pulpy, with a resiny mouthfeel and chocolaty flavors of berry fruits, raisin and vanilla. A long but sticky finish bolstered by tartaric acidity closes out this hot-vintage Tempranillo.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Condado de Oriza 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: On first impression, this smells like a pot of freshly brewed coffee, which is fine at breakfast but not at dinner. Hard tannins are dry as bones and dust, while this tastes of black fruits, blackened spice and black coffee. Toasty oak can be a nice addition to a fine wine, but here it's overwhelming.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Coto 2012 Coto Real  (Rioja)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tannic and oaky, this is rough-hewn with flavors more like Syrah than Tempranillo. Thin, generic fruit is coated in flavors of coffee and vanilla, with a short, bitter finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2016 Estate Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Jumbled aromas include bits of red-flower petal, reedy red fruits, sugar beet, green herbs and wood. A shearing palate, with piercing acidity, calls for food, airing and patience; this tastes of herbal cherry and red plum, while the finish narrows down to an essence of red fruits and acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dolmo 2017 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: While this isn't terrible, for a gran reserva from a vaunted vintage it leaves much to be desired. A stalky nose is briary at best and mulchy at worst. A tannic, raw and rubbing palate deals herbal berry and oak flavors, while the finish is woody and not fruity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Arnáiz 2010 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of raisin and dark plum are gritty and candied, while this Tempranillo feels fleshy but also highly acidic, sort of like aged vinegar. Short, basic plum and berry flavors finish lively and smacking.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Antigua 2016 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Hot berry aromas are loaded with chocolaty oak and wet cement scents. A warm resiny palate sees oaky chocolate flavors take over before this moves on to burnt marshmallow and clove on the finish. This is about as far from natural as you can get.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Protos 2017 12 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Stalky berry aromas control a nose that's low on ripeness. On the palate, this Tempranillo is solidly built. Plum and berry flavors fall flat on the back end, while this offers the minimum in terms of finishing feel and flavors.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cofrade 2018  Rioja

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: While this Tempranillo opens with mulchy, cheesy aromas that suggest less than ideal raw materials, flavors of tomato, creamy oak and herbal plum gain some momentum before finishing short and green. As for feel and structure, this is plump and grabby.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pinuaga 2016 Nature Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Smoky, flinty, black-peppery aromas and flavors give this medium-bodied wine a rustic profile, and firm tannins tighten on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2016 Biodynamic Tempranillo (Mendocino)

Description: Stewed, raisiny aromas hit with a thud. A jammy, tannic palate is devoid of elegance, while this tastes of baked berry fruits and beef jerky in front of a hot, heavy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cyan 2015 Crianza  (Toro)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Mint and clove aromas dominate an unnatural nose. On the palate, this is hard and smacking, with almost no depth or cushion. Grassy, green-leaning red-fruit flavors are oxidized on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mano A Mano 2017 Manon Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Lean, briny, herbaceous aromas of leafy red fruits lead to a linear palate, with no weight, body or depth. This Tempranillo tastes grassy and tart.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Morgante 2017 Tinto Lena Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Murky aromas of red fruits and cheap oak don't amount to anything inviting. This Tempranillo tastes tart and like chicken fat, while similar greasy, weird flavors carry over to a sour finish. This barely passes for acceptable.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Soledad 2017 Solmayor Roble Tempranillo (Uclés)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Stewy, green aromas are better suited to tomato sauce than Tempranillo. On the palate, this is tannic and sappy. Stewed berry flavors are herbal, weedy and overloaded with forced, unintegrated oak that results in a difficult finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mano A Mano 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Earthy cherry, plum and cassis aromas are dry and complex, while this feels integrated and balanced. Cherry, red plum and cocoa flavors remain young and vibrant on the palate, while this pedigreed gran reserva offers its usual depth and length on the finish. Ten years in and this still has more in waiting. Drink through 2045.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2010 Castillo Ygay Gran Reserva Especial  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Maple aromas top ripe berry, black plum and cassis scents as well as notes of raw wood grain and leather. This ripe-vintage Tinto Fino features broad tannins that are dry almost to the point of scraping. Full-blown blackberry and cassis flavors are supported by copious oak, while this tastes chocolaty and slightly woody on a long finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matarromera 2015 Prestigio  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Brambly berry and grainy oak aromas are heady before giving way to more savory earth notes. A saturated palate is rich and dense but not soupy or overly heavy, while this pulses with wild berry, black plum and oak flavors. A long, spicy finish burns a bit, which isn't uncommon in Ribera del Duero, the land of big reds. Drink this heavyweight through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Emilio Moro 2014 Malleolus de Sanchomartin  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bold blackberry aromas are sappy and lush, with a whiff of vanilla coming from the barrel. A nicely integrated palate features grainy tannins, while this tastes of black plum, wood spice and oak resin along with herbal complexities. Oak and related spice and cocoa flavors dominate a long finish with some heat. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Monteabellón 2015 Finca La Blanquera  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A dense, saturated nose weighs in as stout, which is fitting for a wine boasting 15% abv. Bold black fruit aromas pave the way to a rugged palate that's jagged with hard tannins. Black fruit flavors are deep, full and spicy, with toasty oak providing framing. On the finish, coffee and wood spice flavors dominate. Drink through 2027, preferably with beef or lamb.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Protos 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a delicious, immediately accessible and fairly priced Tempranillo, starting with aromas of roasted plums, figs, loam, gravel and clove. Sandy tannins grab hold of the palate, but not too firmly for the creamy mouthfeel, allowing grilled mulberry, star anise and cardamom flavors to take center stage.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rabble 2017 Mossfire Ranch Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smooth plum and berry aromas are ripe and on the money. A full, direct palate is weighty but not heavy, with racy acidity. Blackberry and black currant flavors are fully oaked but don't taste woody, while this Tinto Fino is smooth on a finish with wood spice and vanilla residuals. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Emina 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This rich mouthfilling wine offers concentrated black-fruit flavors that coat the palate and are wrapped in fine-grained tannins. It is full bodied, shows delicious black-plum and dark-chocolate flavors and has a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2016 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an interesting and refreshing take on a grape that's typically thick and leathery. Aromas of barbecued strawberries, crushed slate, gravel and dried rose petals lead into a lightly bodied palate, where light strawberry and pomegranate flavors cling to a taut texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Morgan 2018 Tempranillo (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Slightly stalky berry fruit aromas are supported by oaky notes of vanilla, wood grain and coconut. On the palate, this is fairly fresh and high in tension, with dry, spicy red berry flavors that are notably and properly wood-aided. A hint of buttery oak softens an otherwise tight as nails finish. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valduero 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark-berry aromas of cherry cough drop intermingle with minty chocolaty richness on a full-fledged nose. This is ripe and full on the palate, with popping acidity and firm tannins. Wild berry and chocolaty oak flavors finish long and little by little, with only the slightest bit of Ribera's frequently seen heat and punch. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ferratus 2014 Sensaciones  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Intense plum and berry aromas are strapping but coarse and rough. A drawing palate pulls inward and downward with rugged tannins, while this tastes of hard spices, wood grain, blackberry and dark plum. The finish is similar to the primary palate, meaning tannic, dry and powerful. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2015  Ribera del Duero

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of spice and blackberry meld with a touch of game on the nose. The palate feels tightly coiled in similar tones alongside vanilla, while the finish brings a kick of toasty oak. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Trus 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of spice and blackberry meld with a touch of game on the nose. The palate feels tightly coiled in similar tones alongside vanilla, while the finish brings a kick of toasty oak. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Trus 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Aromas of prune, dried beef and blackberry are dense, indicating that this aged Tempranillo is more bull than ballerina. A big palate shows tartaric bite and some burn, while this tastes of savory berry fruits, cured meat and oak. This is medium in length on the finish; very nice but lacks complexity. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Conde de los Andes Colección Histórica Primera Edicón
Name: Bodegas Ollauri 2004 Conde de los Andes Colección Histórica Primera Edicón  (Rioja)

Description: Full berry and plum aromas are complete as they lead to a racy palate with lively acidity and spirit. Cherry, plum and a dusting of cocoa are lead players on the flavor profile, while this crianza finishes long and fresh. This is everything you want from Rioja crianza.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2017 Viña Real Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy aromas of dried red fruits are spicy and leafy, with no overt ripeness whatsoever. A mix of racy acidity and pulpy fruit makes for a balanced palate with La Rioja Alta's patented elegance, while this tastes of earthy cherry and dried red currant. Only on the finish does one catch a touch of berry ripeness and raisin. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Rioja Alta 2010 Gran Reserva 904  (Rioja)

Description: The Aragonez grape, a k a Tempranillo, has given a dense while elegant wine. Black currant fruits and acidity have now matured into a harmonious whole while still leaving plenty of structure. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2015 Aragonez (Península de Setúbal)
Winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

Description: A fine, stylish wine, this is now mature with ripe tannins as well as smoky flavors. The wine's bright acidity is balanced by ample fruit richness. Drink this fine wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cortes de Cima 2015 Aragonez (Alentejano)

Description: Plum, cherry and earthy spice notes make up a classic Rioja nose, while this crianza from a hot, dry year feels fleshy and ripe. Dark berry flavors push toward the limits of raisiny on the warm finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lopez de Haro 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: A powerful wine, this is dark with tannins that are just beginning to smooth out. The wine has juicy berry fruits and richness that is allowing the wine to broaden out. It should be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta de Ventozelo 2017 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Description: Warm baking-spice aromas meet equally warm, generous berry and cherry flavors in this full-bodied, oaky and enjoyable wine. Cedar, vanilla, cinnamon and wood-smoke nuances coat ripe red cherries and blackberries on a smooth, moderately tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bokisch 2014 Tizona Gran Reserva Tempranillo (Lodi)

Appellation: Alta Mesa, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Saturated with dark-cherry flavors and soaked in velvety tannins, this full-bodied wine tastes delicious and generous, and feels broad and almost gentle despite the tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2017 Reserve Silvaspoons Vineyard Tempranillo (Alta Mesa)

Description: Earthy aromas of slow-cooked beef and spiced plum come with an intense whiff of dried blood and/or iodine. This is shear and medium in weight, with savory plum flavors ruling the palate along with a shock of acidity. High acidity remains on a clipped finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tarón 2008 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A chlorine note rises up from an otherwise basic nose with red berry aromas. On the palate, this feels fleshy but also high in acidity. Red fruit flavors with tomato notes lead to an extended finish that settles comfortably.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Latitud 42 2010 Gran Reserva Colección Especial  (Rioja)

Description: Savory dark-fruit aromas are furry and nutty, with an aged balsamic element. On the palate, this is a bit hot and resiny in feel, while the flavor profile is oaky and spicy, with little fruit character to ponder. A dry finish is hollow and woody tasting. This provides an accurate reflection of a difficult cold vintage in Rioja.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valenciso 2008 10 Años Después Edicíon Limitada  (Rioja)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of cedar and cinnamon lead to rather tart fruit flavors and a grippy texture in this medium-bodied wine. Its mouthfilling, moderately tannic texture will pair nicely with hunks of meat.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Belledor 2017 Tempranillo (Amador County)

Description: A desiccated pop of raisiny berry aromas leads a ripe, sweet nose toward a fleshy palate that's a touch soft and flabby, reflective of a hot, dry vintage. Plum, cassis and raisiny flavors fade on the finish without much structure.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2017 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Dry earth and damp notes on the nose take forever to lessen, while this feels hot and a touch stewy. Earthy, oaky berry and dried spice flavors finish a bit wild and funky. The 2004 vintage was great in Rioja, but this gran reserva is not at the highest level.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Urbina 2004 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A spicy, gritty nose borders on underripe, and by no means is this fruity in aromas or afterwards. Grabby tannins are clamping on a highly acidic palate, while this tastes of savory currant, tomato and lemony oak. A fresh, crisp finish runs long due to acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Burgo Viejo 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Reedy berry and dusty earth aromas are pretty basic, while this feels raw and grainy. Oaky flavors of clove and berry fruits are muddled, while this tastes woody and slightly green and lacking on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2017 Cune Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Strong cedar, cinnamon and charred wood flavors dominate this very firm-textured and full-bodied wine. Its fruit flavors are weighed down by the oakiness and tightened up by noticeable tannins. Its good for oak lovers.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2017 Estate Tempranillo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Ripe, earthy berry aromas include spice notes and a hint of animal while forming the passageway to a great wine. A dense palate is tightly built and pure, with layers of ripe berry, plum and oak flavors that are ideally balanced. This is an extremely generous yet impeccably crafted Tempranillo from an outstanding year; drink from 2025–2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2016 Pagos de Viña Real  (Rioja)

Description: CVNE has been on a roll lately, and this ace from a great vintage only helps to keep that roll going. Stout aromas of bramble, berry fruits, tobacco and fine oak are highly convincing, as is a muscled-up palate that's showing superb structure. Black-plum and cassis flavors are more up front delicious than complex, although further aging may flip the script. Best from 2023 onward.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2016 Real de Asúa  (Rioja)

Description: Early reduction on the nose transitions to cool berry fruit and fine oak as this wine opens. The palate is fully built and saturated, with palpable tannins. Lightly toasted black-fruit flavors meld with mint, while ubiquitous oak cuddles a long, full finish. Hailing from an excellent year, this has a lot to offer; drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Allende 2016 Gaminde Single Vineyard Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A hint of sweet maple on the nose gives way to blackberry, cassis and dark-plum aromas that are in great shape as they set up a lush and full palate. Ripe toasty blackberry and chocolate flavors remain fresh and fruity on a full finish that's not too tannic. For a ripe year, this Ribera del Duero is in superb form. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vizcarra 2015 Torralvo  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Fully ripe black-fruit aromas come with hints of olive and damp earth. On the palate, this is full and kicking, with big tannins that don't tread lightly. Savory berry flavors are true to Ribera del Duero, while this is not overpowering on a long finish. Drink through 2029.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Resalte 2015 Expresión  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: From some of the oldest vines on the Esporão estate, this is a major, dense wine. Its concentrated black fruits, smoothed by aging in wood, are ripe and fully integrated into the wine's tannins. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Canto do Zé Cruz Aragonez (Alentejo)

Description: A saturated color and aromas of ripe black fruits, perfumed oak, vanilla and oud wood are welcoming, while this Reserva feels lush but also racy due to vital core acidity. Toasty oak and deep berry flavors finish long and smoky. Drink now or hold through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luis Cañas 2014 Selección de la Familia Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Made entirely from Tempranillo, this fortified wine is a true delight. Black cherry, candied plums, cola, black tea and coffee liqueur flavors combine, with the sweetness of toffee. It's a lot like a young Port, and makes a delicious after dinner digestif.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2015 Tempus Dessert Wine Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas are slightly reduced and offer hints of animal and leather. Huge tannins make for a rubbing palate, while sunbaked flavors of prune, blackberry and chocolate finish blocky, and with a touch of heat. This seems to have absorbed all the sun and warmth that 2015 delivered; drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rento 2015  Ribera del Duero

Description: Full berry and plum aromas are ripe, lightly spiced and inviting. A fleshy, full-bodied palate features bold tannins, while this delivers sizable black-plum, blackberry and savory oak flavors. Rubbing tannins create texture on a deep finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Roda 2016 Sela  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of violet, blackberry and plum toggle between fruity and floral, while this ripe-year Tempranillo feels a touch heavy, with hard tannins. Baked blackberry and black-tea flavors culminate on a short finish, with minty oak notes and scrubbing tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vega Sicilia 2015 Alion  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Loud oak aromas result in whiffs of butter, olive and rubber along with black-fruit scents. An aggressive palate is rubbing and features hard tannins, while this is loaded with oak flavors and berry fruit. Vanilla, clove, wild-herb and wood-grain notes drive a rugged finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baigorri 2014 de Garage  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are dark and oaky, with a welcome hint of black pepper. This Reserva from a marginal vintage impresses via a lush palate that's generous and fruity. Spicy blackberry, graphite and toasty oak flavors finish with cassis and spicy oak notes. As ripe Rioja goes, this is performing; drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe, stocky berry aromas come with grainy oak notes that try to take over the nose. A firm, clampy palate is tannic and pulling, while this tastes of cassis and raw oak stemming from 20 months in barrel. On the finish, a woody character dominates, although bold latent fruit has its say. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Primicia 2014 Carravalseca Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Nicely presented plum and cherry aromas come with touches of malt, molasses and oak. A fresh and balanced palate is lively and fairly generous, while this tastes of berry, plum, light oak and earth notes. Spice and vanilla flavors carry a steady finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Otano 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas are balsamic and earthy, while this feels sappy, saucy and creamy at the same time. Savory black-fruit flavors are superripe and roasted, while this runs out of steam on the finish due to low acidity. Drink this heavyweight through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matarromera 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-berry aromas meet with leather, smoked meat and mossy earth on the nose of this bottling. Mouthfilling flavors of blackberry juice, wood and vanilla are leveled by mineral-driven touches of crushed rocks and leather.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rexford 2017 Gali Vineyard Tempranillo (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Pure black-fruit aromas include complex hints of lemon peel, graphite and oak spice. A saturated palate is grabby but not heavy, while this tastes of saucy berry and plum. A plump finish is chewy and fortified by rubbing tannins. This Crianza is another indicator of how good the 2016 vintage was in Rioja.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Aspaldi 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Candied notes are attached to fruity plum and cassis aromas, while this feels clampy and rubbery, with almost no give to the palate. Foxy berry flavors are a touch buttery, while oak takes over on the finish. There will be many excellent high-end Riojas from the 2016 harvest; this one will blend into the field.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valdelacierva 2016 Grano a Grano  (Rioja)

Description: Aged in wood for a year, the wine has dusty tannins, spice and ripe black-currant flavors. There is a dry edge to the wine that contrasts with the generous fruitiness and juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casa da Passarella 2015 Enxertia Tinta Roriz (Dão)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though a bit riper than the previous vintage, this has a charred edge to the flavors, perhaps from the barrel regimen. The dominant fruit flavor is lightly leathery dried cherries—right up the varietal alley. There are additional highlights of chocolaty mole adding to the drinking pleasure. The winery suggests further aging for this wine, which seems like a good idea. Drink after 2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Darow Series Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Description: Savory, oaky berry aromas include a note of vanilla. On the palate, this Tempranillo is tight and edgy, with structure and strength. Plum, berry and toasty oak flavors come with hints of chocolate and coffee prior to a finish that has energy and introduces a dash of salt. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baigorri 2014 Mendi  (Rioja)

Description: Lightly baked berry aromas come with ample wood-spice accents and a note of rubber band. While this is flush in feel, it's also fresh and punchy. Plum, currant, tomato-sauce and spicy flavors wrap up, with integrated oaky notes that reflect 18 months spent in American oak barrels. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2014 Excelso Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: On the nose, this is quite oaky, while blackberry and cassis aromas are a bit foxy. A saturated, grabby palate is full and somewhat plodding, while baked blackberry flavors are lightly oxidized prior to a flat finish, with rubbing tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vallobera 2016 Finca Vallobera  (Rioja)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a tasty, well-balanced and nicely structured wine, built for red meat or other rich foods. Moderate tannins make it mouth-watering and palate-cleansing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Winery SF 2016 Tempranillo (North Coast)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Nicely concentrated and extremely smooth, this medium- to full-bodied wine tastes rich and substantive despite its pale-coral color. The peachy aromas and plummy flavors are mouthfilling.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Great Bear 2019 Rosé of Tempranillo (Yolo County)

Description: Prune and candied berry aromas are on the ripe side and thus lack liveliness. A saturated palate is full but slightly lazy and gummy, while this tastes of blackberry and plum. Complexity and deviation from the basics are lacking in this ripe Rioja.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Allende 2014  Rioja

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas come with a rubbery note of pencil eraser. While this is narrow on the palate, it's lively. Red plum, raspberry, currant and a hint of vanilla form the flavor profile, which is backed by a balanced finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sancho Barón 2016  Rioja

Description: Warm, slightly cooked berry aromas are jammy and accented by vanilla and animal-hide notes. A rock-hard palate is pounding and tannic, while this tastes of heavy berry and plum fruit along with grainy, fatty oak. A hard, rubbing finish is bulky, and overall the harmony on this off-year Rioja is questionable.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Primicia 2014 Cofradia Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is shy on the nose at first, offering slight aromas of strawberry, leather and wet soil. The palate is well structured with tight-grained tannins and enough acidity, offering flavors of leather, tar and dark-red fruit.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Monte De Oro 2016 Estate Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Description: Aromas of spice and cinnamon accent gummy berry and plum scents. On the palate, this Reserva is smacking at first, then more pulpy. Grapy berry flavors show some oak, while this hollows out on a racy, snappy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nubori 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy, savory oak aromas sit in front of dried cherry and plum notes, while this feels fresh and snappy, with mild acidic burn. Briary plum and spicy berry flavors qualify as oaky, while this tastes of vanilla, mint and mixed spices on a lightweight finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Eguía 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Berry aromas are ripe and restrained as this flush Crianza opens. Fleshy weight and full tannins lend size to wild-blackberry and black-olive flavors. On the finish, this is rambling, rough and gravelly.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Obalo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried purple-flower, rocky soil, leather and concentrated berry-juice aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's fresh on the palate with blackberry and dried mint flavors, wrapped in slightly tough, chewy tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rincon Mountain 2017 Estate Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Very firm and tannic, this full-bodied wine is rather tight right now and needs time for the texture to relax. It shows oaky aromas, taut cranberry and red-cherry flavors and a lean mouthfeel. Best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Viaggio 2015 Tempranillo (Lodi)

Description: Raisin and baking-spice aromas form a basic opening, while this feels blocky and tannic, with a shock of acidity. Cherry, plum, berry and spice flavors are standard individually and as a group, while this offers a light dusting of baking spice on a finish with residual berry notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tarón 2017 4M  (Rioja)

Description: Damp earth, leather and dark-plum aromas feed into a flush palate. Red-berry, plum and tobacco flavors are standard and pretty much as expected, while this finishes well but without much fanfare.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baron De Ley 2017 Varietales  (Rioja)

Description: Mild berry aromas are welcoming and not pushy. On the palate, however, this is more fierce, with raw tannins. Lightly herbal plum and berry flavors offer tasty subtleties on a tough-textured finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Valdebarón  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Red-fruit aromas are a bit cheesy from oak, while this Tempranillo blend feels tight, snappy and ultimately a bit hard. Limited plum, berry and chocolate flavors wind up on a grating finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Río Negro 2017 992 Cogolludo- Guadalajara Single Vineyard Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Ripe berry and plum aromas are flush and warm, but also a bit fuzzy and furry. Grapey sappiness defines the palate on this black-fruit-driven Crianza that's chocolaty tasting on a bold finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Larchago 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are unique, with notes of evergreen, cherry and barrel spice. Medium-bodied cherry and nougat flavors follow. The oak (60% new European and American) gets in the way.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Art Den Hoed Painted Hills Vineyard
Name: Maryhill 2016 Art Den Hoed Painted Hills Vineyard Tempranillo (Yakima Valley)

Description: Heavy oak attached to fully ripe fruit results in aromas of coconut, wood smoke and creamy blackberry. A sappy, resiny palate is fully extracted and weighs plenty, while this tastes largely of oak, with charred, chocolaty accents.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Volver 2017 Single Vineyard Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Punchy red-fruit aromas of plum and raspberry are lightly oaked. This everyday Rioja is fiery on the palate, with red-alert acidity. That means the flavors are sharp and hard driving—good for pizza and carne asada tacos.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Beronia 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Roasted plum, berry and clove aromas set up a tough, saucy palate with pronounced tannins. Tomato, spiced plum and cinnamon flavors are a bit raw, as is a lean finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Martinez Corta 2017 Cepas Antiguas Selección Privada  (Rioja)

Description: Forced oak on the nose creates an early whiff of menthol and mint. A live-wire palate is charged up and resiny, while oaky flavors of black fruits and pepper end with a final hit of barrel spice.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Latitud 42 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Basic raspberry and cherry aromas are about as good as this gets. The palate feels acidic and gritty, and slightly punishing. Cherry-punch and pineapple flavors are high toned prior to a rough finish. Even for everyday Tempranillo this is lacking.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2017 Protocolo Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Milk chocolate and slightly weedy berry aromas set this off on shaky footing, while a tannic palate doesn't bring it around. Slightly green and minty berry flavors revert to forced oak and chocolate on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Latitud 42 2017 Made with Organic Grapes  (Rioja)

Description: Baked aromas include raisin and marshmallow. A collapsed palate follows the nose, while this tastes mostly of raisin and prune. A soft finish confirms that this is alarmingly low on both freshness and structure.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Viña Jaraba Cosecha Viñedos Propios Unfiltered
Name: Pago de la Jaraba 2017 Viña Jaraba Cosecha Viñedos Propios Unfiltered Red (La Mancha)

Description: Stalky aromas play towards rhubarb, while this is hard and tannic on the palate. Grassy, stalky plum flavors lack ripeness and concentration.                      Michael Schachner
