Name: Bodegas Faustino 2017 VII  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Stalky aromas of damp berry fruits and green herbs lead to a clampy palate. This tastes underdone and a touch weedy, while the same stalky character found on the nose returns on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Morgante 2017 Baila Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Broad and rich, this full-bodied wine packs in plenty of flavor without being overly fruity or jammy. It offers spicy, cedary aromas, good black-cherry and tobacco flavors and a plush texture coated with fine-grained tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Yorba 2012 Shake Ridge Vineyards Tempranillo (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pale pink in the glass, this bottling begins with crisp and chalky aromas of pluot, baking soda and sharp tangerine peel. There's a tight and sharp edge to the palate, which is zesty and fresh with watermelon and lively strawberry-ice flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2018 Indie Rosé of Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Vivid aromas of graphite, tobacco and earth are joined by a ripe black-cherry flavor in this full-bodied, lavishly oaked wine. It has a rich, almost chewy texture, lots of fine-grained tannins for grip and potent fruit concentration that powers through the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Tempranillo (Lodi)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Topped with toasted oak aromas, this full-bodied and well-balanced wine tastes focused, nicely fruity and generously accented by wood smoke and baking spices. It has a lively, slightly gripping texture that's appetizing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mineral Wines 2016 Tempranillo (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of blackberry pair with rich milk chocolate on the nose of this bottling. It hits the palate with impact, with chalky tannins framing the berry-paste and violet flavors. The acid cuts into the rich and nearly sweet flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2017 Life Saver Tempranillo (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of cola and stewed black cherry meet with coffee, caramel and leather on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong roasted cherry and berry sense to the palate, where leathery tannins carry cocoa and caramel flavors into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2017 Chileno Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is affable, enjoyable, well balanced and well polished, making it easy to sip while also offering good structure and a big mouthfeel. Velvety tannins build on the palate and help shape a tangy finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Reserve Tempranillo (Fair Play)

Description: Bright, fresh and fairly concentrated black-fruit flavors fill this medium-bodied wine for a robust impact on the palate without being too heavy or tannic. No added sulfites.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2018 Biodynamic Tempranillo (Mendocino)

Description: This is a zero-added-sulfur wine with big, soft black fruits and gentle tannins. It is juicy and full of red berry fruits, with a fresh, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Terras de Alter 2018 Terra d'Alter ARG Aragonez (Alentejano)

Description: One of a range of single-varietal wines from this quinta, this is a powerful expression of Tinta Roriz, known further east in Spain as Tempranillo. Its tannins give it density and structure while not detracting from the wine's black fruitiness and acidity. As the elements integrate further, this wood-aged wine will be ready to drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Vallado 2016 Vallado Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This reserve sees just 14% new French oak, which is more than adequate, but it's the beautifully ripe, fleshy, firm and deeply rich fruit that holds your attention. Mulberry, cassis and black cherry flavors abound, with seams of graphite and espresso. It's a big wine, but the tannins are so smooth and supple, the fruit so rich and delicious, that it never loses its seamless elegance.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abacela 2015 South East Block Reserve Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Just a few barrels were made of this exceptional wine, done in a sleek and silky style that overturns the impression that Southern Oregon Tempranillos must be big and bloody and tannic. It's packed with pretty blue and blackberry fruit, dappled with baking spices from aging 18 months in mostly once-used barrels. The blend includes 9% Malbec, and the finishing flavors roll into coffee and mocha around lightly grainy tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2016 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Abacela's estate-grown Tempranillos are all marked by deep, dense purple and black fruits, here with a lovely nose of violets and blackberries. The cooperage, just 8% new, brings some coffee flavors into the mix, and the fruit concentrates into plum jam as it moves into a lightly astringent finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abacela 2016 Barrel Select Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery's reserves are barrel selections, as all wines are made with estate-grown grapes. This shows aromatic highlights of bourbon barrel (especially vanilla), along with solid black cherry fruit and details of cut tobacco. The focus, length and purity are excellent.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2017 Winemaker's Reserve Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fiesta is the entry-level cuvée among a number of Abacela's Tempranillos. It's a brilliant introduction to the winery's style—black as dried blood, loaded with chocolaty cherry fruit, and showing a wisp of smoke threading through. The acidity lifts it, and the tannins, soft as silk, help smooth out any rough edges.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abacela 2016 Fiesta Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Blackberries and milk chocolate are the flavors here, smooth and luscious, though showing little in the way of texture or detail. If you want an easily accessible, rich and mocha-flavored red wine, this is the one for you. It gathers a bit of focus as it finishes up with tea-flavored tannins and a streak of vanilla.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Barrel Select Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Fruit for this wine comes from Windy Ridge Estate. The aromas bring notes of dried cherry, cedar, tobacco, vanilla and herb. The flavors are full in feel, backed by lively acidity. It brings a lot of intrigue.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Vizcaya 2014 Tempranillo

Description: Aromas of cocoa, vanilla, fresh tobacco, graphite and black cherry are followed by rounded, palate-coating dark-fruit flavors with a tart finish. A firm coil of tannins connects it together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cinder 2016 Reserve Tempranillo

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A pretty purple-garnet color, this is done in a lighter style, with fruit flavors of wild marionberry fruit. The palate impression is one of drying minerality as it trails out in a balanced finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2017 Estate Selection Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich fruit flavors and equally rich tannins give this full-bodied wine a big profile. It is saturated with black-cherry and black-pepper flavors, is very firm in texture and may need a few years to mature for optimum drinking. Best after 2022.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Uphill Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Tempranillo (Amador County)

Description: Immediately appealing aromas of ripe black fruits, wood spice and vanilla are hefty but exotic, with a sense of class and good things to come. On the palate, this Tempranillo-led blend is stout and shows balance and grip. Woody plum and cassis flavors veer toward raisin and prune on a generous finish. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2015 Hacienda Pradolagar  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cuddly berry aromas include a hint of raisin. The palate echoes the nose, meaning this is full and ripe, with smooth tannins supporting raisiny softness. Cassis, exotic spice notes and baked berry flavors are lush on the finish. This seems ready for near-term drinking; enjoy now through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vega Sicilia 2014 Valbuena 5°  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Smoky, toasty oak sits atop hard spice, earth, floral berry and vanilla aromas on a nose that's complex and true to Rioja gran reserva. A tight-wire palate is firm and braced by racy acidity combined with ripe, hefty fruit. Cherry, plum and currant flavors are savory and saucy, while this closes with power and tension, indicating that it will be good to drink for at least another 15 years.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Monteleiva Gran Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia
Name: Marques de Tomares 2010 Monteleiva Gran Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia  (Rioja)

Description: Dense aromas of prune, blackberry, leather and vanilla open this lusty, full-bodied Rioja that presses the pedal to the metal. Flavors of blackberry and baking spice transition to mocha and cassis on the flush finish. Drink this fully ripe and extracted Tempranillo-based blend through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Beronia 2015 III a.C.  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe blackberry, prune and baking spice aromas grace the nose of this Tempranillo blend that includes all of the approved red Rioja grapes. A tannic palate is grabby and grinding, but not fierce. Plum and berry flavors are slightly baked and ripe, while this feels dry and rubbing on a finish that tastes of prune and cassis. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Bilbainas 2015 Viña Pomal Compromiso  (Rioja)

Description: Spicy oak, espresso and black fruit aromas are welcoming in front of a rich but structured palate with tannic tightness. Blackberry, cassis and prune flavors finish firm and dry. Give this high-quality modern Rioja some time in the cellar. Drink 2022–2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Leizaola 2015 El Sacramento  (Rioja)

Description: A powerful nose is initially closed and gaseous, but in due time it opens and delivers brambly, leathery black fruit aromas and smoky oak. A grabby palate is chalky and tight, while this Toro tastes dark and toasty, with spicy berry and cassis flavors that push up against desiccated and raisiny. This is probably more flashy and ripe than deeply structured. Drink now through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vega Sicilia 2014 Pintia  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Smoky oak aromas sit atop berry and cassis scents on what amounts to a classic RDD nose. A clampy palate is tannic and tough, while this tastes of oak-driven chocolate, baked black fruits and raisin. A strong oak element persists on a ripe finish with vanilla and prune notes. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Neo 2014 Punta Esencia  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe berry, prune and raisin aromas are at the core of a nose that's also driven by coconut and vanilla accents. A rustic mouthfeel with grippy tannins frames savory, oaky red berry and plum flavors, while tobacco and vanilla notes are corralled by a drying finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2010 Viñas Viejas Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a fun and fresh take on Tempranillo, with an equally playful label. Aromas of lavender, boysenberry, potting soil and a touch of telltale leather lead into a palate framed by rounded tannins, a bit more of that earthy leather and a full array of fresh fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Say When 2018 Weird Parties Martian Ranch & Vineyard Tempranillo (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Creamy lactic oak aromas settle on vanilla, toast and berry fruits. On the palate, this feels full, grabby, dry and intense. Oaky flavors of baking spices, blackberry and prune turn raisiny on a dry finish that hollows out faster than you might like. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Primicia 2015 Julian Madrid Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A full, ripe nose include aromas of vanilla, spiced plum and raisin, while this gran reserva from a hot year feels tight as nails on the palate. Spicy plum, currant, leather and earth notes capture the essence of a warm vintage, while this exerts a firm tannic grip on the finish. Drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Olabarri 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is rustic in all the right ways, beginning with aromas of roasted berries, toasty oak, smoked herbs, a hint of beef and plenty of sea salt. More dried flavors of berry, herb and meat show on the palate, where fresh acidity keeps it lively.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2016 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Nicely spiced dark-fruit aromas of plum and blackberry are steady and stout. On the palate, this is tight and rough, with scratchy tannins that really dig in. Blackberry, spicy oak and prune flavors wrap up on a drying, texturally abrasive finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Alma de Vino Old Vine Crianza
Name: Montebaco 2014 Alma de Vino Old Vine Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This gran reserva from a lauded vintage opens with prune, roasted berry, tar and leafy notes, making it intriguing and complex but not entirely easy on the nose. An edgy, raw palate is snappy as it offers earthy, leafy berry, tea and spice flavors. Tension, earthy grit and leafy notes rise up on a raw finish. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Hidalgo La Gitana 2010 Alameda Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy, spicy plum and red berry aromas are solid and in harmony. This reserva shows depth and balance along with ripe berry, cassis, chocolate and brown sugar flavors. On the finish, this is more subtle and smooth than loud. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baron De Ley 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Oversize aromas of toasty oak, baked berry fruits and blacktop lead to a fully extracted and tannic palate that takes no prisoners. Blackberry and forceful oak flavors suggest a smoking campfire, while this is dry, tannic and choppy on the finish. Give this all the air and patience you can; 2015 was a hot year, and this reflects that. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: García Figuero 2015 Milagros de Figuero  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Ripe, chunky black fruit aromas reflect a hot year but get a freshness boost from lemony oak. A thick palate is creamy and oaky, with prune, vanilla and chocolate flavors. A fat finish is almost too ripe and heavy, but not quite. This should appeal to fans of ripe red wines.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2015 Selección Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Fully ripe black fruit aromas are slightly raisiny and a touch flat. On the palate, this reserva from a hot year is weighted down by rubbery tannins and ripe berry fruit. Flavors of prune and raisin are at the core of a slightly overripe flavor profile, while this remains full on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Monteleiva Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia
Name: Marques de Tomares 2011 Monteleiva Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Stewed strawberry, licorice dust and red-plum aromas show on the nose of this bottling by a Temecula winery using Paso Robles fruit. More baked strawberry comes out on the palate as does roasted fennel, toffee and vanilla, proving relatively light but very flavorful.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Bolero Cellars Bella Collina Vineyards Reserve
Name: Europa Village 2016 Bolero Cellars Bella Collina Vineyards Reserve Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Cherry and plum aromas are at max ripeness and include a friendly note of vanilla. On the palate, this is choppy but lively. Plum and vanilla flavors are lifted by lemony oak, which offsets a note of raisin brought on by the warm and dry conditions of the 2015 vintage.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Olabarri 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick, bright and high toned in red currant, this is a medium-bodied, temperate wine, with well-integrated oak and tannin. It shows mountain structure and power that endures on a lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Imagery 2016 Upper Ridge Vineyard Tempranillo (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cheesy oak aromas combine with earthy black fruit scents on a nose that's not in top gear but isn't stalled, either. A huge, tannic palate rates as a wide load, while flavors of blackberry and black cherry are short on depth and complexity. As might be expected, this is hard as rocks on the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dominio de Atauta 2015 Torre de Golbán Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: An opaque purple color and baked aromas of raisin and black fruits come in front of a chunky, tannic palate that struggles to support itself. Grapy blackberry, cassis, raisin and spicy flavors finish with grit, excess weight and notes of coconut and blackened toast. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Barón de Traus NV Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Spicy oak with a chocolate twist rests comfortably on top of berry fruit aromas. A racy, tough palate is rubbery but lively and balanced, while blackberry, plum and chocolate flavors simmer on a finish with clean but notable oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2016 Sagasta  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ultraripe aromas of raisin, prune and blackberry come across as mushy and overdone. A saturated palate is sappy and heavy, with tartaric acidity offering a boost. Flavors of prune, raisin and cassis are almost too ripe, while aforementioned acidity keeps this from collapsing on the finish. The 2015 vintage was a hot one, and this wears it.                      Michael Schachner
Name: 12 Linajes 2015 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are natural and unadulterated by unwelcome oak. This is dry and fresh on the palate, with medicinal cherry, herbal plum and light oak flavors. An easy finish with light cherry notes wraps this up.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Viña Alarde  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Overripeness is spread all over this RDD, starting with aromas of raisin, prune and vanilla and then moving on to a jammy palate with distinct raisin and prune flavors. This is friendly and welcoming as a whole, but decidedly raisiny at all checkpoints.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Convento Oreja 2014 Memoria Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Rubbery dark-fruit aromas are sound but limited, while this Tempranillo feels rugged, tough and tannic. Spicy berry flavors come with savory undertones of salt and dried fruits, while the finish reverts to tannic and edgy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ochoa 2014 Crianza Tempranillo (Navarra)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bela is the new Ribera del Duero property from CVNE in Rioja. This is a different type of RDD, one with exotic blueberry and spice aromas that settle on gamy and sauvage. But on the palate, it's hard and tannic, with the pinch of astringency. Herbal plum and currant flavors have a tea and grass-like quality, while this is spicy and suggestive of nutmeg and green herbs on a hard and grabby finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bela 2017 Estate Grown  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Cool blueberry aromas are touched up by exotic notes of cardamom and lavender. On the palate, this is fully extracted and tannic. Spicy berry and plum flavors are dry, with sappy weight playing out on a heavy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Palacio del Burgo 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: This warm-vintage crianza is a bit unfocused and leafy on the nose. On the palate, however, it shows better, with fullness and grab. Baked berry flavors struggle to show total clarity, while this offers raisiny notes on a warm, chunky finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siglo 2015 Crianza Edición Oro  (Rioja)

Description: Berry, raisin, vanilla and spice aromas are common, while this is thick and heavy on the palate, with grating tannins. Berry, mocha and chocolate flavors wrap up on a grabby finish that tastes baked and slightly overripe.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2014 Óscar Tobía Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are good in a standard and familiar way. A full-fruit palate is a bit grinding, while berry, black plum, cassis and prune flavors finish steady but with clamping tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montebuena 2017 Cuvée KPF  (Rioja)

Description: Raisin and spice cake aromas are backed by vanilla, tobacco and foxy berry notes. A hard, tannic palate shows rubbery grip, while this tastes of spiced plum and vanilla. Oak and chocolate flavors push up on sappy, jammy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Martelo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Grapy aromas of plum and berry are round but inexact. On the palate, this is full-out jagged and rubbing, with rock-hard tannins driving the mouthfeel. Generic berry and spice flavors are good, but this lacks finesse on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Obalo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Early aromas of intrigue include cinnamon, lavender, wet cement and clay, which give way to spiced cherry once this crianza airs out. A racy palate with bright acidity offers basic berry, plum and spice flavors. On the finish, this is drying and steady.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Cerrada 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Cherry and spice aromas are calm and clean on the nose. Next in line is a smacking, lean palate that plays up a steady plum flavor. As value-priced Rioja goes, this is quite good.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kirkland Signature 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Foxy plum and cherry aromas come with a hint of minty green. On the palate, this standard Tempranillo feels choppy and edgy, without much middle ground. Plum and herbal flavors finish dry, with freshness and a note of latent oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carlos Serres 2018 Old Vines  (Rioja)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are earthy, with a hint of compost in the mix. A heavy palate is flat, with rubbery tannins. Herbal berry flavors carry a note of mint, while this is grinding and tannic on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2017 Selección  (Rioja)

Description: Grainy oak, blueberry and kirsch aromas come in front of an impermeable palate that's hard, closed and smacking. Oaky dark-fruit flavors include a note of prune, while this is plump and severe on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Burgo Viejo 2017 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Damp earth and plum aromas include a slight hint of olive. On the palate, this is big and mouthfilling, with rubbery tannins. Roasted berry flavors are short on depth and finish with rubbery tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Monteleiva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia
Name: Marques de Tomares 2017 Monteleiva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A wild berry aroma is untamed and a touch green on the nose. A pulling palate with rubbing tannins ranks as rough, while this tastes of fiery berry fruits with blackened accents. A dry finish brought on by dry tannins closes out this full-volume RDD.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viejo Mundo 2017 4 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: La Rioja Alta often leans toward traditional, and this is in that mold but still sort of lacking. A light, rusty color and stalky red berry aromas lead to a dry, hard and rubbing palate. Leafy, earthy plum flavors are lightly oaky and simply not that fresh or exciting.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Rioja Alta 2014 Vina Alberdi Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of Band-Aid and foresty berry fruits come with a hint of herbal green. A tangy, zesty palate leans toward angular, while flavors of plum and pie cherry finish crisp, zesty and clean. If ever there was a blueprint middle-of-the-road Tempranillo, this would be it.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rioja Vega 2018  Rioja

Description: Resiny green oak aromas give this a damp, foresty outlook. On the palate, this is compact almost to the point that it caves in. Cherry and red berry flavors come in front of a minty finish that struggles to hold up.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Bujanda 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: An opaque purple color is ominous and backed by a raisiny nose that's sun-baked and sleepy. An oversize palate is tannic, while flavors of milk chocolate and bourbon barrel give this an oaky, forced character. A shallow finish confirms that this is a size-over-substance RDD.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Legado de Orniz 2017 Cindus  (Toro)

Description: Foxy berry aromas are accompanied by forceful notes of raisin and wet dog fur. On the palate, this is full but edgy and grinding. Generic berry and raisin flavors finish with hints of prune and cocoa powder.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campellares 2017  Rioja

Description: Gummy plum aromas control a reduced nose. On the palate, this is pushy, raw and almost unfriendly in how tannic it is. Sappy, fiery plum and berry flavors have an herbal undertone, while this mercifully lightens up on the finish. This is Toro in tough, unwieldy form.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Elias Mora 2017  Toro

Description: Leathery raspberry and cherry aromas are fairly flat, while this basic Tempranillo feels clipped at the edges and hollow in the center. Foxy plum and red berry flavors lack depth, while this feels rubbery and squeaky on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Covila 2018 II Tinto  (Rioja)

Description: Berry aromas are peppery but beyond that nondescript, with cool oak that suggests wet cement. A clampy palate is drying and tannic, while this tastes mostly of creamy oak and milk chocolate. A dry finish evaporates, leaving heat.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vallobera 2016 Familia San Pedro Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Raw, medicinal berry aromas are earthy at best, stalky at worst. A tight, snappy palate is light in body but feels rubbery and tannic, while stalky plum flavors finish with a hint of mushroom.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Adivino 2018 Tinto Joven  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of raw berry fruits and pushy oak lead to a grabby palate with sticky, drying tannins. This everyday Rioja tastes mostly of forced oak and clove, while the finish tastes almost entirely of clove. Overall, this comes across as manipulated.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Ugalde 2018  Rioja

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong tangy aromas meet with boozy touches on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also tangy with sour black-plum and wild herb flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2014 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This generous wine is full in body and packed with ripe black fruits wrapped in dark chocolate. Fine-grained tannins give support on the palate and balance the opulent fruitiness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tinto Rey 2015 Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)

Description: This wine has a bouquet of blackberry and espresso bean. It is soft at first sip, but then smooth tannins envelop the palate amid flavors of cassis, black plum, coffee and baking spice. There are notes of chocolate and anisette on the finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Netofa 2016 Dor Tempranillo (Galilee)

Description: Meaty berry and plum aromas are dark and solid. A saturated palate shows full extraction of ripe Tempranillo fruit; but in the end, this feels a bit blocky and stumpy. Blackberry, vanilla and savory spice notes finish mostly with creamy oak and latent vanilla. This is ripe, intense, oaky and powerful. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Gaudium Grand Vino  (Rioja)

Description: Sweet, cheeky aromas of vanilla, cappuccino and coconut are derived from the barrel, while this modern-style Rioja is flush and tannic, meaning it's a mouthful. Oak-driven flavors of coffee, mocha and cream are a big part of a black fruit flavor profile. On the finish, this remains weighty and oaky. Drink through 2029.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2014 Dalmau  (Rioja)

Description: Full-force aromas of plum, vanilla and herbal tomato leaf are convincing, as is a charged-up palate that doesn't grate or grind. Plum, wild berry and creamy oak flavors finish with a mocha hint. This plays well from start to end. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vega Sauco 2011 Adoremus  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A dark, smoky nose with Bourbon barrel richness and concentrated black fruit aromas leads to a strict palate that's tight as nuts and bolts. A dark, smoky flavor profile is driven by toasty oak, while dark chocolate comes in on the finish. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Legaris 2011 Calmo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Vanilla, spice, cherry, plum and lemony oak aromas are lusty and full. In the mouth, this off-vintage wine is raw and clamps down with biting tannins. Baked plum, chocolate and charred flavors finish with an oak character on top of a dried plum and cherry base.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2014 Martin Cendoya Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Bold berry fruit and oaky vanilla aromas are integrated and inviting. In the mouth, this crianza from a strong vintage feels deep, flush and layered, with firm tannins. Blackberry and black currant flavors don't go much further on a staunch finish. Drink this steady crianza over the next few years.                      Michael Schachner
Name: 12 Linajes 2016 Crianza Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Fresh berry and red plum aromas are lifted by complementary notes of oak grain and vanilla. This value-priced crianza from a very good year feels flush but primed by punchy acidity. Red plum, berry and a hint of wood spice make for a classic Rioja flavor profile, while this remains tasty and fresh on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montecillo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Traditional Rioja aromas of red berry fruits, spice and vanilla fill the nose of this crianza from an excellent vintage. On the palate, it is tight and juicy in spicy plum and currant flavors.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Dried plum and cherry aromas include spice and mulchy notes. This is yet another 2013 Rioja that's got issues—which doesn't mean this isn't without its charms. A tannic palate is raw and gritty but built to last. Cherry and red berry flavors finish short. Drink through 2034.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2013 Viña Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Berry and plum aromas come with ample oak and touches of smoke and char. The palate brings flavors of plum, blackberry and vanilla lifted by bright acidity, with an extended mocha finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Beronia 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of concentrated berry jam and white pepper make for a pleasant entry to this bottling. It's also hearty on the palate with black-cherry, leather, tobacco-leaf and roasted meat flavors, proving mouthfilling but not overly heavy. Stiffer tannins hold everything in check.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castoro Cellars 2017 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are adequate but not the stuff of legend. In the mouth, this off-vintage gran reserva is solid but a bit jagged and choppy. Warm, earthy plum and berry flavors come with a mild chocolate backing prior to a balanced finish. Given the difficulties of 2013, namely extended cold weather, this is commendable. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2013 Cune Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A saturated purple color and jammy plum and berry aromas are dense and slightly reduced, although airing helps this along. A flush, grapy palate is fairly tannic and grabby but not overly rough. Blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors finish full, pulpy and chunky.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tionio 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Berry and cherry aromas are soapy at first, then deeper and cleaner with airing. This reserva offers a bouncy, saturated palate with lift. Berry fruit and black plum flavors are spiced up on a robust finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of baked berry fruits, cassis, maple, vanilla and tobacco are encouraging. In the mouth, this is smacking and wide, with rubbing tannins. Bold berry, plum and black currant flavors show prune and herbal notes on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2014 Fincas da la Villa Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Light aromas of cherry, raspberry, pencil eraser, cedar, graphite and plum lead to fruit puckering fruit flavors. The tannins give a firm squeeze. The wine provides a lot of quality and value. Give it a short decant if drinking in the near term.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Temporal 2017 Tempranillo (Washington)

Description: A full but flat nose includes berry and plum fruit and oaky grit. A big, bulky palate has rubbery tannins, while berry and oak flavors are slightly awkward and baked rather than focused. A plump finish is generous but short on structure and purity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Leizaola 2014 El Sacramento  (Rioja)

Description: Mature, almost murky aromas of leafy berry fruits are not exactly fresh. High acidity has created an edgy, clipped palate, while currant, pie cherry and raspberry flavors wrap up on a lean and spirited finish. This will last another 10 years, but the fruit is already on the slide.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2010 Reciente Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Jammy berry aromas are spicy and oaky. This gran reserva from a ripe, warm vintage feels thick and borderline syrupy. Mocha, plum, berry and chocolate flavors finish wayward, and overall this is oversize and a bit out of shape.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Otano 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy berry and plum aromas come with some oak, and overall the nose on this crianza is in order. A crisp, wiry palate is braced by popping acidity, while this tastes of currant, plum and cherry. As the fruit fades on the finish, what remains are hard tannins and the residue of citric acid.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 HZ Abascal Vineyard Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Raspberry and plum aromas fairly introduce a racy and forward palate with punchy acidity and raw tannins. Red berry flavors are jammy, and overall there's a lot of fruit to this bumpy ride of a reserva.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Familia Montaña 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: On the nose, this crianza is full and dense, although airing helps it along. A bright, juicy palate is emboldened by acidity and grating tannins, while this tastes of cassis, black plum, berry fruits and vanilla. A steady finish continues with that theme.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Portia 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Lemony oak and pine notes are part of a nose that also offers berry fruit scents. In the mouth, this crianza feels choppy and racy. Plum and currant flavors are lightly spiced in front of a finish that stomps on its way out.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Calm berry aromas open this crianza that's packed with fruit. Big and bold flavors of grape skins, plum and berry fruits turn drier and spicier on a finish that's lively and fairly long.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Berceo 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Berry and cherry aromas are jumbled at first, but better with airing. On the palate, this is kicking with acidity and choppy tannins. Plum and cherry flavors are bold on a tannic finish with a touch of heat. While tasty and intense, this reserva is brusque.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Reciente Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: New leather, dried red cherry and red-plum aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is decent tension to the sip, where leathery flavors of tobacco and earth meet with dried cherry fruit.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Danza del Sol 2014 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soil, slate, cracked peppercorn and old leather aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines those elements with tobacco leaf and hearty blue fruit, which grows a tad sour toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Felten Cellars 2015 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: A dark color and warm aromas of plum, raisin and prune announce a fuller-bodied wine. In the mouth, this feels sappy and extracted, while black cherry and prune flavors are darker and fatter than what you find in most crianzas. On the finish, dark-fruit notes quickly give way to prune.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Vargas 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Ripe berry aromas border on raisiny, while overall this reserva smells baked and soft. A chunky palate is bolstered by grabby tannins, while blackberry and black plum flavors hint at mocha and clove on a spicy but drawing finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Palacio del Burgo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Generic plum and berry aromas are spicy and tight. Similarly, the palate on this Tempranillo feels tight, hard and snappy. Flavors of black fruits, rubber and oak spice conclude on a dry, edgy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Obalo 2018  Rioja

Description: A wiry nose is herbal and raises questions about ripeness. In the mouth, this is tight and choppy, with aggressive tannins. Herbal plum and wild berry flavors finish spicy and tannic, with a final hint of green. In the end, this isn't underripe, but it certainly shows the typicity of Navarra, which can lean toward green.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2014 Reserva Tempranillo (Navarra)

Description: Ripe berry and cassis aromas show some oak prior to a raw, rough and rubbing palate. Baked black plum and berry flavors are true to Toro, while a dry, tannic finish deals leftover flavors of black plum and spice. Drink when ready; this is not for aging.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matsu 2017 El Picaro  (Toro)

Description: Cherry aromas are mildly medicinal, like a cough drop. This is a bold Rioja that rumbles on its way toward jammy berry flavors and hints of chocolate and spice. Despite being obtuse and a bit candied, this doesn't come up short on fruit.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Viña Pomal Selección 500 Edición Especial Crianza
Name: Bodegas Bilbainas 2014 Viña Pomal Selección 500 Edición Especial Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are a bit rubbery in front of a smacking palate that's tight and racy. Red plum, currant and tomato flavors finish tight, with nothing loose or gangly. This crianza plays up the fresh, no-frills side of Riojano Tempranillo.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Coto 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas smell a bit damp as well as like asphalt. A bumpy, edgy palate is dried out by rubbery tannins, while blackberry, cassis and grapy flavors are generic through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Landaluce 2015 Fincas de Landaluce Reserve  (Rioja)

Description: Warm, almost furry berry aromas set up a narrow palate with plum-like acidity. Berry flavors are desiccated but pushed by bold acidity, while this holds form on a finish made more aggressive by aforementioned high acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Leza García 2015 LG  (Rioja)

Description: Dark aromas of plum and berry are boosted by spicy oak. In the mouth, this is tight and pulling, with no cushion to the palate. Dry, woody berry flavors are good but limited, while this tastes spicy, resiny and oaky on a tight, tannic finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Larchago 2018  Rioja

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A strong blast of oak is front and center on the nose of this crianza, which carries a distinct aroma of barbecued meat. Fierce tannins are at the heart of a concentrated palate, while toasty oak and minty dark-fruit flavors finish with spice and resin notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Legón 2016 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dense, charred aromas control a soupy nose with reduction and not much fruit. In the mouth, this is heavy, syrupy and in need of a lift. Flavors of black tea, cured beef and stewed plum finish hot.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matanegra 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: A rusty color and earthy, almost nutty aromas of mulched berry and forest floor lead to a tannic, sappy palate. Leafy, spicy berry flavors are more murky than fresh, while this tastes leafy, herbal and of green tobacco on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Bujanda 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Jumpy berry and black fruit aromas are clean but unsophisticated. A smacking palate with pounding acidity holds flavors of plum and berry fruits that don't deliver the ripeness and richness that Toro is known for. On the finish, this is grating and superficial.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cermeño 2017 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Toro)

Description: Jumpy berry and black fruit aromas are clean but unsophisticated. A smacking palate with pounding acidity holds flavors of plum and berry fruits that don't deliver the ripeness and richness that Toro is known for. On the finish, this is grating and superficial.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cermeño 2017 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Toro)

Description: A jammy nose falls a bit flat and stewed. In the mouth, this is not just dry but it's drying due to starching tannins. Prune and plum skin flavors finish very dry, much like the palate feel.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eduardo Garrido García 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Sharp aromas of pine and red fruits lead the palate with fresh acidity as well as oxidative notes. Cherry and berry flavors rank as standard, while crisp and smacking acidity offsets mild oxidation on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Manzanos 2018 Siglo  (Rioja)

Description: Olarra turns out a lot of wines across many labels and at some point they become one in the same. For what it's worth, this reserva opens with smoky, oaky aromas and fruit notes that suggests hand lotion. A rubbery and full palate offers red fruit tannins backed by darker fruit flavors. This is tight and tannic on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Cerro Añon Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Reduced berry and black plum aromas include notes of rubber glove and latex. This everyday Rioja feels big and full, but also kind of clumsy. Slightly soupy flavors of plum and rubber remain on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Burgo Viejo 2018  Rioja

Description: Damp berry aromas come with a covering of chemical oak. A smacking palate is tannic and aggressive, while this tastes of berry fruits giving way to prune and raisin. A tough finish is fitting.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Burgo Viejo 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: A compacted nose smells raisiny. Next in line is a fleshy, jammy palate that's unfocused. Raspberry, plum and prune flavors finish with a low pulse, and overall this is unexciting.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Palacio del Burgo 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Grainy oak dominates a nose that's thin on fruit and backbone. In the mouth, this is jagged and rubbing, while grapy berry flavors are mildly oxidized. On the finish, this tastes more like wood than fruit.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viore 2017 5 Meses en Barrica  (Toro)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Candied red fruit aromas are medicinal and hard to take seriously. This Tempranillo feels rubbery and scratchy, while plum and raspberry flavors are both fiery and slightly artificial. A dry, tannic finish tastes herbal and comes across hot.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas 2018 Viña Temprana Old Vines Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)

Description: Raisin, blueberry and bubblegum aromas announce a sketchy, faulty wine. In the mouth, this is syrupy, heavy and tannic. Pasty, lactic flavors of oak blanket gooey fruit notes, while on the finish this is creamy in feel and green in flavor.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vega Sauco 2017 La Sonrisa del Nomada  (Toro)

Description: Smooth aromas of mature berry fruits and plum amount to a silky whole touched up by café mocha. A saturated palate is packed with pulpy black fruit, while this tastes of blackberry, tobacco, coffee and oak. A smooth finish with a meaty texture and chocolaty notes concludes this dense holdover from a cold year. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Remírez de Ganuza 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Charred, toasty oak aromas lead an earthy nose with deep blackberry fruit. This is medium-plus in size, bordering on big, but there's restraint and balance to the palate. Dark berry flavors benefit from chocolaty oak, while this holds on to its fruit on a sizable but smooth finish. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: García Figuero 2015 Reserva 15 Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Charred, toasty oak aromas lead an earthy nose with deep blackberry fruit. This is medium-plus in size, bordering on big, but there's restraint and balance to the palate. Dark berry flavors benefit from chocolaty oak, while this holds on to its fruit on a sizable but smooth finish. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: García Figuero 2015 Reserva 15 Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Rooty aromas of vanilla, turned earth, pepper and berry fruits are comfortable and congruent. While this is smacking on the palate, spicy plum and currant flavors are high in quality. On the finish, this tastes of oak grain and spice, but in a good way. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Val de Los Frailes 2015 Pago de las Costanas Tempranillo (Cigales)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A ripe, concentrated nose is front-loaded with black fruit scents, toasty oak and cool earth aromas. This winner is medium to full by Ribera del Duero standards, and well balanced. Flavors of black cherry and blackberry only get stronger the longer this sits. On the finish, this dries out while feeling chalky and minerally. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Virgen de la Asunción 2015 El Secreto de María  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: This crianza offers a flush, full-volume palate, with classic Rioja flavors of plum, raspberry and currant that don't fade or falter on the finish. Drink now–2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campillo 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe berry aromas come with a fitting helping of toasty oak. On the tongue, this is tannic and resiny but not overly so. Flavors of blackberry, raisin, oak grain and vanilla dry up on a desiccated finish with mild oxidized notes. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Balbas 2014 Ritus  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spicy black plum and wild berry aromas are not overly ripe or rich. Following that lead, this feels chippy and tight on the palate, with drying tannins. Flavors of roasted plum, hard spices and toasty oak finish with additional woody notes. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Legón 2014 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: An intense nose is blasting with foresty, cool power and depth. On the palate, this is stacked with fruit and backed by seriously fierce and rough tannins. Savory flavors of soy and spice lead meaty berry fruit to a finish that is rock hard and in step for a bruising red such as this. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Elias Mora 2015 Descarte  (Toro)

Description: Warm malty aromas of maple and ripe berry fruits turn woody with airing. Reflective of a hot but very good vintage, this settles quickly on the palate and is never overly lively. Spiced plum, berry fruit and chocolate flavors finish with mild oak spice on an easy finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lealtanza 2012 Reserva Selección de Familia  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe black fruit aromas are earthy and accented by cola, prune, licorice and tobacco. It is wiry and tight in feel, with flavors of vanilla and tobacco over a blackberry core. The finish brings a blazing streak of acidity. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: García Figuero 2015 Noble Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are nicely spiced, and overall this reserva smells sound and mature. A tight, slightly choppy palate offers flavors of spiced plum, cherry, cola and cocoa. On the finish, this is steady but low on secondary flavors and complexity. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Lacort 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy, leafy plum and berry aromas are spicy, while this cool-vintage reserva feels dense and grabby. Flavors of tobacco, spiced plum and oak outmuscle the wine's fruit, while this is mouthfilling but plodding on the finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 Viña Alarde Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Earthy berry and plum aromas are full and accented by mocha, oak grain and smoked meat notes. A lush palate is all about fruit and freshness, while this crianza tastes of plum, raspberry and baking spices. A steady finish brings this to shore with no issues. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siglo 2015 Crianza Selección  (Rioja)

Description: A small-production, lightly wood-aged wine, this celebrates Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo) with its great aptitude for producing ripe wines in the Douro. Its firm tannins are still in place, balanced by the juicy black currant flavors. The wine could do with another year, so drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2016 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of mashed berries, cheese rind, oak and milk chocolate carry the nose of this wine. The choppy palate is tannic and biting, while this tastes of game and berry fruits prior to a grapy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vizcarra 2015 JC Estate Bottled  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Raisin and prune aromas are out front on the nose, which is backed by a sappy palate. Baked plum, prune and chocolaty oak flavors finish soft and wan. With so many excellent Rioja reservas to consider, this one gets lost in the shuffle.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2013 V Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Baked, raisiny aromas are unmistakable. Not surprisingly, this is thick and chunky on the palate, with a dammed up flow. Black currant and raisiny flavors push the limits of acceptable ripeness, while this feels thick and tastes lightly oxidized on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Resalte 2014 Expresion Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy, baked aromas are meaty, minty and herbal but not entirely clean and pure. This wine from little-known Cigales is tight to an extreme, bordering on astringent. High acidity makes woody plum and red berry flavors screechy, while the finish is dry and driven by oak and acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carlos Moro 2015 Finca Valdehierro 16 Meses Barrica Tempranillo (Cigales)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are fairly deep and dense, with a touch of prune in the background. On the palate, this crianza is chewy and full, with rough tannins. Blackberry and grainy oak are the key flavors, while this Tempranillo feels a bit rubbery and tastes slightly of prune on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Primicia 2016 Primicia Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: Slightly murky and earthy black plum aromas are a bit jumbled but not problematic. This varietal Tempranillo crianza feels full and tannic, while plum and berry flavors transition to fresh prune on the finish. At 14.5% alcohol, this is pretty big for a crianza, but in a good year like 2016 it makes the grade.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Landaluce 2016 Fincas de Landaluce Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de Calidad de Valtiendas, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Briny, leathery berry and black olive aromas require plenty of air to unwind. A wide but unfocused palate deals grating tannins, while this tastes of ripe black fruits. A blocky finish is rocky, as is this entire offering from just outside the Ribera del Duero DO.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Evolet 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de Calidad de Valtiendas)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A highly saturated nose smells outright raisiny. On the palate, this is dense as mud and tannic. A mix of overripe berry and tomato flavors amounts to a saucy whole, while this feels warm and sappy on a finish that's massive but shy on elegance and character.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Portia 2014 Triennia  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Forceful oak-based aromas of clove and cinnamon are less than natural, while this is powerful, raw, gritty and pinched on the palate. Wood-based flavors of clove and cinnamon sit on top of blackberry fruit, while this tastes of black plum and blackberry on a sappy, oaky finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: García Figuero 2016 Viña Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of red apple, vanilla and cherry, not sitting entirely squarely. Full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors follow. A tart finish caps it off. There are some interesting things happening, but they don't all mesh.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: King Estate 2016 Sonrisa Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dark aromas of asphalt, blackberry and charred wood are low on elegance. On the palate, this feels wide and resiny, but short of character and focus. Woody flavors of jammy berry and clove finish with a heavy dose of wood spice that seems forced and slightly artificial.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Resalte 2016 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Earthy plum, cherry and raspberry aromas comprise a level nose with a hint of green. On the palate, this is smacking but full, with wiry acidity. Plum and berry flavors finish well but short, without much follow-through.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montebuena 2016 Cuvée KPF Estate Bottled  (Rioja)

Description: Raspberry and cherry aromas are common for Rioja crianza. A choppy palate with lemony acidity is shy on body, while this tastes of red plum, currant and a touch of buttery oak. Hollowness is a factor on a finish with mild heat and grape skin tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Beronia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are brooding, with notes of dried herb, baking spice, wood spice and dark fruit. Full-bodied flavors follow but don't quite have the stuffing to pull it all off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Columbia Winery 2016 Tempranillo (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Ripe berry, raisin and oak aromas lead to an edgy palate with rubbery tannins. Plum and berry flavors are a touch raw and sappy, while this loses some steam on the finish, which tastes raisiny and mildly oxidized.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rioja Vega 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)

Description: There are more piedras (rocks) to this than princesas (princesses). The nose is ripe but a bit chemical, while the palate throbs with aggressive tannins and grinding acidity. Berry and chocolate flavors are fiery, and overall this is more high octane than anything else.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vega Sauco 2015 Piedras & Princesas  (Toro)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Gritty aromas of baked berry fruits and road tar lead to a clampy, pinched palate that's rugged and pulling. Raisin, blackberry and charred burnt oak flavors revert to prune and raisin on a warm, baked finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Emina 2016 Pasión  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: An asphalt aroma masks the nose, while on the palate, this is rough and biting. Roasted black fruit flavors include a note of olive, while this feels rugged and rough on a scratchy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matanegra 2016 Perillan  (Ribera del Duero)

Appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Overly ripe aromas suggest raisin and pencil eraser. On the palate, this is choppy and lacks flow. Baked flavors of raisin and prune are desiccated, while this tastes jammy and feels hot on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tamaral 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

Description: Cooked berry and plum aromas qualify as rustic. On the palate, this Tempranillo is grabby and scrubbing. Herbal plum and tomato sauce flavors are raw on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Latúe 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Lean cherry and currant aromas are not all that ripe or convincing. A smacking palate holds flavors of candied red fruits, while a hot and fiery finish closes out this wine.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Arráez 2017 Callabuig Tempranillo (Valencia)

Description: Dark berry aromas come with tire rubber harshness. On the palate, this is thick and soupy. Flavors of forced oak and red berry fruits finish green and minty.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Familia Bastida 2016 Vuela Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Stewy, soupy aromas are hardly inviting, while this feels raw and tomatoey. Salty, underripe red fruit flavors are green and weedy on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Illana 2017 El Pico Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Description: Stalky aromas are burnt and raw, as is the palate. This tastes weedy and salty, and the mouthfeel is grabby.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Cortijillo 2017 Joven Tempranillo (La Mancha)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The chimney, funk, earth, mineral, fresh tobacco, peat and spice aromas draw you into the glass. The fruit and savory notes are elegant but flavorful, with a long finish capping it off. The balance is impressive.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cayuse 2016 Impulsivo En Chamberlain Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas are expressive, with notes of firepit, dried tobacco, cherry, plum and funk. The fruit and savory flavors are rich and layered, showing an exquisite sense of balance. A long fruit, savory and firepit-filled finish follows.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: No Girls 2016 Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a six-acre vineyard that the owners planted by hand, this is an impressive early showing for this winery. Dark in the glass, the wine shows aromas of boysenberry, blackberry, violet, jasmine and vanilla. The palate continues that fruit-forward expression but wraps it in sticky tannins and persistent acidity. Drink 2020–2031.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rincon Mountain 2016 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: From a vineyard located 3,000-feet high in the mountains above Temecula, this bottling shows concentrated black-cherry and oak aromas on the nose. Chalky tannins frame the grippy sip, where smoke and more black-cherry flavors ride strong acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Temecula Hills 2016 Estate Tempranillo (California)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Candied red-cherry and star anise aromas pop on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also simple but pleasant, with flavors of red cherry, strawberry and a hint of herbs, finishing with vanilla.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2016 Bolero Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Here's an unusual style, with mixed flavors of wild berry and green leaf. Some sweetening spice notes come up also, along with a swirl of maple syrup through a finish with more flavors of bark and leaf. Somehow, it pulls itself together.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Eliana 2016 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This big-boned wine spent two years in barrel, 40% new. The ripe black fruits run all the way into cassis, with aromatics and flavor highlights that suggest wet hay. There's a heavy dose of vanilla, though the winery indicates that the barrels were French rather than American oak. At such high alcohol, this wine shows some back palate burn, and is best drunk soon.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2015 Tempranillo (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Very little Tempranillo is grown in the Willamette Valley, as to fully ripen it requires the sort of heat found in southern Oregon. This is soft and herbal, with light suggestions of brambly fruit. Overall the wine seems muted and indistinct, without any particular varietal specificity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Vidon Vineyard 2016 Explorer Tempranillo (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The grapes were sourced from the Delfino vineyard, but although Tempranillo is well-established in the Umpqua Valley, this wine is astringent, chalky and underripe. Bare flavors of lemon and apple conceal any hint of red fruit, and the astringency has a concrete-like dryness. Drink up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willful 2017 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Malty berry aromas are supported by cocoa, mocha and berry-fruit scents. This has a jammy plum and berry palate, with a ripe, slightly desiccated red-fruit-flavor profile. Depth and balance drive the finish, which is usually a good indication that aging will only help. Drink through 2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Contino 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Smooth, steady aromas of dark fruits, turned earth and oak grain are exactly what you want from a high-quality Rioja Gran Reserva. On the palate, this is pure and tight, with clarity and structure. Flavors of dried plum, cherry, raspberry, spice and cocoa are expansive and finish with elegance. Drink through 2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Cinnamon and spice aromas are big parts of an oak-driven nose. A full, plodding and tannic palate is concentrated and grating in feel. Heavily toasted and blackened berry flavors finish with complex notes of cocoa, licorice, wood spice and toast. Drink this massive Tempranillo through 2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Finca El Bosque  (Rioja)

Description: Rock-solid aromas of berry fruits, graphite and olive are compact and holding plenty in reserve. A racy and packed palate is bold and shows the stuffing, acidity, tannins and overall balance to age for many years to come. Flavors of black plum, olive and cassis are mildly chocolaty on a firm finish. Drink at any point over the next 40 years.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2011 Martin Cendoya Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Savory oak matched by malty berry-fruit aromas are toasty, chocolaty and inviting. A full-bodied palate is solid but offers just enough give, while this tastes of blackberry, savory oak and vanilla. A steady and long finish continues the core theme of this wine: balanced ripeness and power. Drink from 2020–2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Alma Tobía Tinto de Autor  (Rioja)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked beef in a cherry-compote sauce, minty herbs, loamy soils and wet slate are all aromas that present themselves on the compelling nose of this bottling, which spent 36 months in barrel. The palate is smoky in flavor, with black-cherry and purple-flower touches and stiff tannins that carry into the savory finish. Drink 2020–2030.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2015 Gran Reserva Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Central Coast)

Description: Earthy berry, plum and spice aromas are smoky, toasty and integrated on the nose. This feels full and saturated on the palate, with smooth but present tannins. A jammy flavor profile includes blackberry and other black fruits, while a vanilla note accents the concentrated berry flavors on the finish. This has the stuffing and structure to age a long time; best 2024–2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2015 Conde de los Andes  (Rioja)

Description: Welcoming aromas of cola, oak and earthy plum are a touch tarry and fiery. On the palate, this shows moderate to good depth but still seems a bit narrow. Flavors of leafy, earthy berry and plum are lightly oaked and finish with spice notes attached to lingering berry and plum fruit. Drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2011 Barón D'Anglade Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Savory oak and spicy foresty berry aromas are a touch gritty. A grabby palate with controlled astringency tastes of salty, lightly stalky plum and raspberry, along with vanilla. Earthy berry and oak flavors dominate a finish with tannic rub. Drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: CVNE 2015 Imperial Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Black-plum and cassis aromas include an exotic spice note akin to cardamom. In the mouth, this is smacking and dense. Baked black-fruit flavors include notes of black coffee, cocoa and burnt toast. On the finish, this stays chocolaty in flavor and comfortable in feel. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Summa Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Slightly desiccated aromas of prune soften toasty dark-fruit scents. This Reserva from a warm vintage is tight and braced by red-fruit acidity. Plum and raspberry flavors are spicy like a fine Rioja should be, while this finishes with integration and a firm texture. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of black cherry, charcoal, olive and cola make for a compelling nose on this young Tempranillo. The palate combines deep and dark blackberry and black-plum flavors with charred beef, iodine and more black olive.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Croma Vera 2017 Joven Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Description: Jammy blueberry and cassis aromas set up a fleshy flush palate that qualifies as jammy. This tastes of blackberry, plum, vanilla and coconut. On the finish, ripe fruit flavors are compact, forward and stowing energy to spare. Drink through 2040.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Covila 2011 II Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Tar, smoky plum and berry aromas are fine but light on complexity and elegance. This feels tight, with edgy tannins, while roasted plum flavors finish short on depth. For a high-end Reserva from a great vintage, this is just good enough to recommend.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altanza 2010 Sorolla Reserva  (Rioja)
